Richie has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising pigs.

Richie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

NWTF is presenting Evangeline's request for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Elizabeth has a business buying and selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 41 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, canned goods and other groceries. Erlinda has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Erlinda hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Flordeles

texts.en:
Flordeles is 42 years old and married with six children. Flordeles works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Flordeles has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and farming coffee businesses.

Flordeles aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Dally

texts.en: As a married parent of seven children, Dally works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming bananas and coconuts. Dally is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her banana business. Dally has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is a 50-year-old, married woman from Corella, Bohol. She has five children. She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for 22 years. She sells items like canned goods, soft drinks, powdered soaps, biscuits and snack foods like chips and peanuts. Marcela requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks like Pepsi, biscuits, and snack foods like chips and fried peanuts. In the future, Marcela would like to expand her business to be more productive and at the same time send her children to school for their future.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 58 years old and a widow with eight children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emelia has been farming rice for 1 year and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Emelia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 45 years old. Veronica is married and has three children. To make a living, she manages a fishing business. She has been in her business for 15 years and earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Veronica joined GDMPC. Veronica is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to repair fishing materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair fishing materials

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 26,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell to customers. 

Rovelyn has been in this business for four years. Rovelyn earns more income from food vending. 

Rovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.en: Ni Ketut requested a loan of 6,000,000 IDR which will be used to buy seeds of cucumber and chili. In addition, the loan capital will be used to buy all kinds of daily necessities for sale in her kiosk. Ni Ketut and her husband are excited to launch this new venture. They hope, if all plans go well, the kiosk will have a lot of customers and the garden will produce satisfactory results.

loans.use: To buy seeds of cucumber, chili and all kinds of daily necessities for sale in her kiosk

loans.name: Greyler

texts.en:
Greyler is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. 

Greyler has been in this business for six years. Greyler earns more income from farming rice and buying and selling charcoal. 

Greyler has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 63 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She sells feed in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional feed to sell. 

Fe has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 12 years and also earns income from vegetable vending. 

Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is married with two children. She is 42 years old and lives in Panta-on, Ozamis City. Marilou has a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years and earns 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Marilou been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC since just this year. In the future, Marilou's plan is to save for some future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to customers. Lolita has been in this business for 32 years. Lolita earns additional income from dried fish vending.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
This is Mercy, 48, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a businessman, and mother of three children, two of whom are already in college, while the youngest is still in high school. By the grace of God, Mercy has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Mercy. She herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Mercy operates a vulcanizing shop. To vulcanize is to harden rubber by combining it with sulfur or other substances in the presence of heat and pressure. This is usually done to punctured tires. Vulcanization gives rubber strength, resistance and elasticity. She also sells tires. They have a tire supply. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 60,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more equipment for their business and also for items used to maintain their equipment. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mercy dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more equipment for their vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en:
Jenelie is 32 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Jenelie works very hard to provide for them. 

Jenelie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. 

Jenelie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future Jenelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizer and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming coconuts. Rebecca is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to customers.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Madame Adama habite au Sénégal.  Elle s’active depuis 4 ans dans le secteur du commerce  et exerce la vente de jus de fruits en sachets.  Elle est mariée et les revenus que lui procure  son activité l’aide a participer au règlement des factures  au sein du  foyer. Elle commence chaque jour sa journée à 14 heures  pour terminer à 18 heures.  Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour acheter des jeans qui seront destinés  à la vente. Son objectif consiste à diversifier son activité de commerce  dans le but  d’augmenter ses revenus pour mieux  assister son conjoint dans la gestion des charges de la famille. Son rêve  est de voyager  régulièrement vers un des pays limitrophes du Sénégal pour se procurer des jeans à revendre.
texts.en: Ms. Adama lives in Senegal. She has been active in the commercial sector for four years and sells packets of fruit juice. She is married, and the income generated by her business helps her participate in contributing to the household expenses. She begins each day at 2PM and ends at 6PM. She is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC and is seeking a loan of 150,000 Frs to buy jeans, which will be resold. Her goal consists of diversifying her business with the aim of increasing her income in order to better help her spouse in managing the family expenses. Her dream is to travel regularly to one of the countries bordering Senegal to obtain jeans for resale.

loans.use: To buy jeans for resale.

loans.name: Serges

texts.fr:
Serges est un jeune homme de 26 ans marié. Père d'un enfant de 7 mois, il vit dans un quartier de la capital. Il detient une boutique dans un coin de la place où il exerce depuis 02 ans et vend divers accéssoires tesl que: les téléphones prtables, les chargeurs, les ceintures, les sacs de classe et bien d'autres. Grace a son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine il s'est fait une clientèle grandissante qu'il aimerait continuer de satisfaire. pour cela il sollicite un prêt qui lui permettra dacheter (les téléphones, les chargeurs, les chauffes-eaux, les torches, les multiprises et les radios de poche).
Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêr lui permettront d'augmenter son capital, d'agrandir sa boutique et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Serges is a married young man aged 26. Father of a 7-month-old child, he lives in a neighbourhood in the capital. He has had a store in the area for two years, where he sells various items such as mobile phones, chargers, belts, schoolbags, and many other articles. Thanks to his dynamism and competence in the field, he has gained a growing clientele whom he would like to satisfy. For this reason, he is seeking a loan that will allow him to buy telephones, chargers, water-heaters, flashlights, powerstrips, and pocket radios.
The profits from this loan will allow him to increase his capital, expand his store, and better provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy telephones, chargers, water heaters, etc.

loans.name: Joyeuse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Adela est membre dans le groupe de crédit Joyeuse, entrepreneur très ambitieux expérimentée. Elle est mariée et mère de d’un enfant. Son mari est un cultivateur. La cliente est vendeuse de braises. Elle étale ses marchandises au marché central de Majengo. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima. Environs 5 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Durant le cycle de crédit passé, elle a connu beaucoup de cas de maladies dans sa famille. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 5 sacs de braises. Cette cliente est confortable avec son business. Dans le futur, elle compte acheter une parcelle et construire une maison d'habitation. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.
texts.en: Adela is a member of the group Joyeuse. She is a very experienced and ambitious entrepreneur. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer. Adela sells charcoal. She sells her merchandise in the central market of Majengo. She started her business with her own funds. Later, she sought help from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has had this business for about 5 years. During her previous loan cycle, there were many cases of illness in her family. This new loan willl enable her to buy 5 bags of charcoal. Adela is comfortable with her business. In the future, she plans to buy a plot of land and build a home. For this, she would like to thank Hekima for its support and for empowering women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Peru! La Sr. Guillermo es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Esperanza de vida con el futuro”, un grupo conformado por 8 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.

Guillermo se dedica a la venta de Locería es decir platos tazas adornos vasos, Guillermo compra por mayor y los vende a domicilio este negocio surge a raíz de que su esposa falleció y el se quedo con sus 4 hijos y tenía que mantenerlos y cuidarlos
Guillermo ha solicitado el préstamo  para comprar  Locería (Platos, vasos adornos), para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

Guillermo es viudo y tiene 4 hijos. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, Guillermo gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos pudieron estudiar, poco apoco fue comprando cosas para su hogar y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida. Guillermo esta muy contento con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva.
texts.en:
Hello from Peru! Mr. Guillermo is part of the communal bank “Esperanza de vida con el futuro” (Hope in life for the future), a group of 8 members that all have diverse economic activities. 
Guillermo sells dishware like plates, cups and decorated glasses. Guillermo purchases wholesale and then sells the items from his house. His business began because his wife passes away, leaving him with their four children and he had to raise them and take care of them on his own. 
Guillermo is applying for  a loan to purchase more dishware (plates, decorated glasses) and in doing so be able to attend better to his customers.
Guillermo is a widower with four children. Thanks to is hard work and dedication, he has earned better economic returns, his children can study and little by little  his entire family is seeing a better quality of life. Guillermo is very happy with this loan and thanks Edaprospo as well as Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase plates and decorated glasses.

loans.name: Ma. Darlie

texts.en:
Ma. Darlie is 40 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Darlie is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional piglets and feeds.

Ma. Darlie has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, a bag of salt, a bag of spaghetti and other items

loans.name: Dasa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Dasa works hard to support her family.

She has a business in the Philippines, buying and selling dried coconut meat. She earns additional income from buying and selling rice, and farming coconut. Dasa is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell for her dried coconut meat business.

Dasa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her three of her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.fr: Monsieur Gaspard vit au Sénégal. Il évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le secteur de l’éducation et est enseignant de profession. Il est marié et assure une parie des  dépenses quotidiennes de la maison. Il commence sa journée a 08 heures jusqu'à 14 heures dans l’après midi.  Il est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de la localité ou il habite et sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour la construction d’un mur de clôture pour sa maison.  Ce financement lui permettra de rénover son cadre familial.  Il souhaite avoir une école chez lui.
texts.en:
Gaspard lives in Senegal. He has been in the education sector for over 10 years and is a teacher by profession. He is married and provides for a portion of the household expenses. He starts his day at 8 am and finishes at 2 pm. 

He is a member of the UIMCEC office in the area where he lives and is asking for a loan of 150,000 francs to build a fence for his house. This financing will allow him to renovate his house. 

He would like to have a school at his house.

loans.use: to build a fence for his home

loans.name: Francisco  Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, reside en el municipio de Tecuantepe, este pertenece al departamento de Managua. El es casado, su núcleo familiar es de 4, su esposa y dos hijas menores de edad, que están a su cargo.
el trabaja como conductor en una empresa privada, pero debido a la situación económica, tuvo la iniciativa de crear su propio negocio donde en sus horas libres ofrece el producto, el vio que una de sus alternativas era la venta de ropa de segunda. Por lo que  se dispuso echar a andar su proyecto ahora el tiene ya seis años de tenerlo; empezó ofreciéndole a sus propios compañeros de trabajo, en las horas en que no  perjudicara los horarios de trabajo y le fue bien,  así también se fue expandiendo en su propio barrio y tubo muy buena aceptación ahora el ya tiene sus propios clientes y se siente satisfecho con lo que esta logrando.  

los sueños de él es tener un mejor nivel de vida  para su familia, lograr que sus hijas sean unas profesionales del cual esta luchando siempre para que su sueño se realice. 

Francisco escucho acerca de los servicios que ofrece Ceprodel como Institución financiera y decidió solicitar un préstamo ya que esta necesitando realizar unas compras para su negocio ya que por la temporada navideña que se acerca los pedidos son más fuertes. Quiere comprar la siguiente mercadería una paca ropa  para niño, paca de ropa interior y paca de ropa variada, y cumplir con la demanda que esta teniendo actualmente.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in the municipality of Tecuantepe in the department of Managua. He is married and his immediate family has four people, his wife and two daughters, both young, all of whom he takes care of.
He works as a driver for a private enterprise, but because of his economic situation, he has had to start his own business in his free time to sell something and he saw that selling second hand clothes  would be a good option. And so, he began to get his business together and has been building it for six years now; he began by selling items to co-workers in the free time he had when it didn't interfere with his full time position and it went well, and so he expanded his business to his neighborhood and he also had success there and now he has his own clientele and he is very satisfied with all he has achieved.  His dream is to give a better quality of life to his family and see his daughters make professional careers, something for which he is always fighting for, so that he can see his dream come true. Francisco heard about the services offered by Ceprodel and he decided to apply for a loan since he is needing to purchase more items for his business for the Christmas season that is drawing near and his customers are asking for more. He wants to purchase the following merchandise: a pack of children's clothing, a pack of underwear and a pack of a variety of clothing in order to meet demand he currently has for these items.

loans.use: purchase pack of children's clothing, a pack of underwear and a pack of a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Esnang

texts.en: Esnang is 42 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Esnang runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Esnang has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Esnang would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
Carmen,  es originaria del departamento de Masaya, tiene la edad de 41 años, comerciantes desde hace 16 años, en la venta de lotería Nacional. Esto lo tiene como herencia de sus padres ya que  se dedicaban a este mismo oficio. Ella también busca la manera de sobresalir ya que también posee un pequeño negocio de venta de productos cosméticos y de uso personal.Sus puntos de ventas son fuera de Masaya como Catarina, Granada, esto para brindarle una mejor condición  de vida  a su familia. Madre soltera y tiene a su cargo  dos hijos. ella es la que tiene que llevar el sustento a su hogar; Pero que se siente orgullosa de que su familia no les falte nada.

Uno de sus principales reto es mejorar su vivienda ya que el techo lo tiene deteriorado y necesita cambiarlo por ese motivo solicita a Ceprodel un préstamo con el que pueda comprar zinc, hierro 3/8, perlin, y también pagar la Mano de obra de los que le harán el trabajo.
Carmen se siente alegre del logro que obtendrá ya que de esta manera mejorara la comodidad de su hogar y les dara una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is originally from Masaya, she is 41 years old and has been in business 16 years, selling National lottery tickers. She inherited the business from her parents since they were also in the same kind of sales. She is looking for a way to improve her situation because she already owns a small business selling cosmetic products and other personal products. She sells at different locations in Masaya like Catarina and Granada in order to give her family a better quality of life. She is a single mother who is in charge of two children. She is the one who needs to take care of her home, but she is proud of her family and doesn't feel she is missing anything. 
One of her main goals is to improve her home since the roof is deteriorating and she needs to replace it. This is why she is applying for a loan with Ceprodel, she will use it to purchase zinc sheets, iron, rafters and pay for the labor. Carmen is happy to be able to obtain these things and in this way improve her home's level of comfort and be able to give a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheets, iron, rafters and labor.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a 42-year-old, married woman with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Amalia has a general store business in the Philippines. Amalia requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF, to purchase more grocery items like bread, soft drinks, and canned goods. 

Amalia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Amalia would like to save money to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like bread, soft drinks, and canned goods.

loans.name: Margen

texts.en: Margen a 37 years old, married, and has 4 children. She is from Liposong, Ozamiz City. To make a living, Margen grows coconuts and bananas to sell, which she has been doing for 6 years. She earns 6,000 PHP a month. Margen is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Margen joined GDMPC in 2007. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers

loans.name: Muliati

texts.en:
Muliati is a 37-year-old woman who is married to Ali, a 35-year-old man. They are blessed with two children named Siti, 11, who is in the sixth grade of elementary school and Fitri, who is 5.

Muliati owns a food stall business and sells food items including meat balls, nasi campur (mixed rice), nasi rendang (rice with beef curry), fried chicken, fried soy bean, etc.
 
She has been involved with the business for years. At first she sold only yellow rice but she was able to improve her business by expending the range of food she sells. A couple of days ago, Muliati initiated a simple food stall located near the main road. She plans to buy more equipment and cooking ingredients but she has very limited capital to do so, therefore she applied for a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. She plans to use the loan to buy a new display window, more plates, beverages, a cool box, and cooking ingredients.

loans.use: to buy a new display window, more plates, beverages, a cool box and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Primitiva is 52 years old and has 2 children who are still in school.

Primitiva has a business selling chicharon (pork crackles) in the Philippines. Primitiva has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy meat and other ingredients for her chicharon.

Primitiva has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Primitiva would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy meat and other ingredients for her chicharon (pork crackles).

loans.name: Pio

texts.en:
This is Pio, 40, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Elvira, a housewife, and a father to his children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Pio operates a retail business. What he basically does is buy bread at wholesale then sell in smaller quantities to customers for a profit. He already has regular bakeries where he delivers bread. His regular customers are his neighbors and some bakeries in his local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales daily.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more bread of different kinds to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Pio hopes his business will grow in the coming years and dreams to have his own house through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different kinds of bread that he will use in his business.

loans.name: Xiomara Marisol

texts.es:
Xiomara, tiene la edad de 30 años, casada,  tiene 3 hijos; es originaria del municipio de niquinohomo este pertenece al departamento de Masaya,  Su esposo y ella no recibieron una buena educación debido a que no tenia las posibilidades de terminar sus estudios. 

Ella actualmente trabaja como asalariada en el una empresa estatal desde hace 6 años y su esposo como agricultor entre los dos ha sacado adelante a sus hijos porque consideran que la educación es primordial en la vida y tienen el sueño de que sus hijos sean unos buenos profesionales en el futuro.

Actualmente uno de sus principales problemas que están teniendo es que su vivienda esta un poco deteriorada, debido a esto quieren hacerle unas mejoras a su hogar, solicita a  Ceprodel un préstamo que pueda comprar los materiales de construcción que esta necesitando que son compra de piedras canteras, Cemento, Mano de obra.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 30 years old, married and has three children, she is originally from the municipality of  Niquinohomo that is in the deparment of Massaya. She and her husband did not receive a good education since they did not have the opportunity to finish their studies. 
She is currently working as a salaried worker at a state business and has been there for 6 years and her husband works in agriculture and between the two of them they have given their children better opportunities because education is fundamental to a better life and their dream is that their children will be professionals one day. Currently, one of their biggest problems  is that their house is deteriorating and so they want to make some improvements to their home and so they are applying to Ceprodel for a loan with which they will purchase construction materials that they need like quarry rocks, cement and labor.

loans.use: purchase quarry rocks, cement and labor.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married and has 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Arlene is 50 years old, and five of her children are in school.

Arlene has a food preparation and vending business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a loan amount of 11,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy ingredients for her food business.

Arlene has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Arlene would like to save money for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food preparation and vending business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, 40 years old, is a married entrepreneur living in Lapasan, Clarin with his two children. He has run a transportation services business for almost ten years. He earn 6,500 PHP a month. To improve his business, Joseph is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit. He joined GDMPC recently for a loan to buy accessories and tires. He hopes to expand his business soon.

loans.use: to buy accessories and tires.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and earns additional income by buying and selling rice, grains and dried coconut. Nida is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional items for her general store.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza del Socorro de  56 anos de edad del municipio de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La Sra. Esperanza tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente económicamente. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de bolsas plásticas y tiste. Negocio que lo desempeña hace ocho anos. El negocio consiste en vender bolsas plásticas de todo tamaño y tiste que es una bebida típica de nuestro país elaborado a base de maíz y canela. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El negocio lo inicio cuando quedo desempleada y tenia que buscar una forma de vida para seguir luchando y trabajando para el pan de cada día. Esperanza ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para comprar material de trabajo como bolsas plásticas al por mayor, y maíz, canela, leña.  Esperanza agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener una fuente de trabajo propia.
texts.en:
Esperanza del Socorro, 56 years old, is from the municipality of Leon, located in the west of the country. Esperanza has 4 children, all of them adult and economically independent.  She sells plastic bags of all sizes and 'tiste', a Nicaraguan drink made from corn and cinnamon. Her business has operated out of her home for some 8 years now.

Esperanza began the business when she was unemployed and had to find a new way of life to continue struggling and working for her daily bread. She has worked with the Foundation previously and demonstrated her responsibility by making the required payments on time. 

Esperanza needs financing to purchase supplies such as plastic bags at wholesale, plus corn, cinnamon, and firewood. She is grateful for the help offered by Kiva investors so that people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua can have their own source of work.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make powders used in local corn drinks.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Antonia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock.

Antonia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, etc..

In the future Antonia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF. She has been running her charcoal business for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elizabeth aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 55 years old and married, with one child. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Estrelita is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF, to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Estrelita has been pig fattening for 30 years, and she earns additional income from fish vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save money to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, tiene la edad de 57 años, casada, tiene dos hijos estos  mayores de edad e independientes; reside en el departamento de Masaya, también llamada ciudad de las flores;  Ella es comerciante desde hace 8 años, decidió crear su propia forma de ingreso debido a la situcion económica de nuestro país, comenzó con capital propio y gracias a Dios ha ido amentando, ella posee una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación vende  los 7 días de la semana; Porque sus clientes asi se lo demandan y también porque son productos que son de uso diario como es el alimento.

Actualmente quieren aumentar su negocio por lo que decide a solicitar a ceprodel un crédito en el que pueda comprar los siguientes productos coca cola, big cola, arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijol, huevo, carbón, leche nido, y pamper; este crédito le permitirá que su negocio aumente sus ventas y siempre mantenga satisfecho a sus clientes porque podrán encontrar siempre el producto deseado.
texts.en: Doña Rosa is 57 years old, she has two children who are now grown and independent. She lives in the department of Masaya, which is also known as the city of flowers. She has been a businesswoman for 8 years when she decided to start her own source of income because of the economic situation of her country. She started with her own capital and thanks to God, she has seen her business grow, she owns a pulpería (a grocery store) that she runs from her house and is open 7 days a week because her customers asked her to open every day and also because her products are everyday items for daily use like food. She is currently wanting to grow her business and that is why she decided to apply for a loan with Ceprodel, so she can purchase the following items: coca-cola, big-cola, sugar, oil, beans, eggs, wood, powdered milk from the brand Nido as well as diapers. This loan will allow her to grow her business and he sales and to keep her customers satisfied because they will always be able to find what they need.

loans.use: purchase coca-cola, big-cola, rice, sugar, oil, beans, eggs, wood, milk and diapers.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from Avon sales.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 47 years old and married with four children.

Leah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, snack foods and other grocery products.

Leah has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from tricycle transportation.

Leah aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, snack foods and other grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and widowed with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for ten years and earns additional income by buying and selling house decorations.

She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 34 years old, married, and has two children. Fe is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Fe requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fe has been pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Fe would like to save money to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 65 years old and married with thirteen children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 45 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods, soap, canned goods, etc.. 

In the future Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for eight years. She also earns income by buying and selling charcoal and farming rice.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut and the other members of loan group Kucup Mekar will use their loan to purchase piglets and feed and renovate the barn. Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase two superior piglets for fattening. Ni Ketut and her husband are hard workers. Every day they spent their time at their garden to tend their crops and care for their pigs.
Ni Ketut hopes MUK micro finance will support them with the loan until they have enough savings to provide their own capital to run the business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed, and renovate the barn.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.

Evelyn has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more banana to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more banana to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lolita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 35 years now.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 55 years old and is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nila has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Nila has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Nila has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Nila would like to save money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 40 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hog raising business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40 years old and married with seven children. With six children in school, Juliet works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Juliet has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, milk, drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nihla

texts.fr: Nihla est un jeune camerounais âgé de 33 ans, vivant en concubinage avec une femme et a deux enfants  de 4 et 3 ans. Comme activité, il possède un petit dépôt de bois depuis 1 an et demi dans un quartier de la ville. Il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter 250 lattes de bois et 250 planches afin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises. Il voudrait avec le bénéfice réalisé améliorer sa situation professionnelle et soutenir les conditions de vie de sa famille notamment subvenir à l'éducation de ses deux enfants.
texts.en: Nihla is a young Cameroonian aged 33, cohabitating with a woman, and has two children aged 4 and 3. As a business, he has owned a small shop selling wood for one and a half years in a neighbourhood of the city. With this loan, he would like to buy 250 boards of wood and 250 planks in order to increase his stock of merchandise. With the profits, he would like to improve his professional situation and provide for his family, especially with regards to the education of his two children.

loans.use: To buy boards of wood.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 42 years old and married, with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Liza is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Liza has been raising pigs for 13 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save money to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nyanga

texts.fr: NYANGA est une femme célibatiare qui vit dans un quatier de la capitale. Mère de famille, elle tient un petit hangard où elle propose diverses qualités de fruits en l'occurrence des papayes, des oranges, des mandarines, des ananas,des lemons, des citrons et des pamplemousses. Grâce à sa détermination et sa sympathie elle s'est faite une clientèle de renom dont elle aimerait toujours assouvir les besoins en fruits. Elle sollicite donc ce crédit pour effectuer des achats en grande quantité dans les campagnes. Les bénéfices tirés de cet emprunt lui permettront d'augmenter son capital et par ricochet d'agrandir son commerce tout en subvenat aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Nyanga is an unmarried woman who lives in a neighbourhood in the capital. She is the mother of a family, and has a small stall where she sells various types of fruit, in this case papayas, oranges, mandarins, pineapples, lemons, and grapefruit. Thanks to her determination and friendliness, she has gained a well-known clientele, whose demand for fruit she would like to satisfy. She is thus seeking this loan to buy large quantities of fruit from the fields. The profits from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and indirectly expand her business, all the while providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in bulk from the fields.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store business. Shirley has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is 31 years old and married, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Bebelyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy additional items to sell. Bebelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soap, sugar, and soft drinks.

In the future Bebelyn would like to save money to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items, like canned goods, soap and sugar, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.fr: Evelyne est femme mariée et agée de 43 ans. elle exerce comme activité la vente de layettes; de vetement et fait également de la confection qu'elle vend dans un marché de la place depuis 5 ans deja. céci dit, elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine, ce qui lui aura permis de se faire une bonne reputation. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des vetements pour augmenter son stock de marchandises actuel afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. elle voudrait aussi acheter des tissus et des fils qui constitue la matière première pour son activité de confection. les revenus générés permettront d'aider son époux à supporter les charges familiales. elle a pour ambition pour son activité d'acheter des tenues scolaires pour les vendre afin de diversifier ses produits et d'agrandir à terme son activité.
texts.en: Evelyne is a 43-year-old married woman who runs a business selling baby clothes; she also makes clothes and has sold them at a local market for five years already. Thanks to this, she has gained good experience in the field, which will allow her to develop a good reputation. With this loan, she would like to buy clothes to increase her current stock of merchandise in order to better satisfy the demands of her customers. She would also like to buy fabric and thread, which constitute the raw materials for her clothes-making business. The income from this business will allow her to help her husband provide for the family. Her business ambition is to buy school uniforms to sell in order to diversify her products and eventually expand her business.

loans.use: To buy and make clothing for sale

loans.name: Xochilt Del  Rosario

texts.es:
Xóchitl es casada y madre de una linda niña menor de edad, tiene la edad de 29 años; es originaria del departamento de  Masaya. Actualmente es dueña de su propio negocio desde hace 2 años, esto a que anteriormente trabajaba como asalariada en unas de las empresas obreras que existe mucho en nuestro país; Decidió poner su renuncia y pensó que con su liquidación podía echar a andar su negocio y así fue como empezó a trabajar. Este consiste en la compra y venta de pacas de ropas y zapatos de segunda, abrió su mercado en Matagalpa donde tiene sus clientes y considera que le ha ido bien,  porque le a dado buenos resultados; también quiere expandirse a otros departamentos cercanos y de esta manera aumentar su negocio.

xochitl necesita realizar unas compras de mercaderia, pero no tiene el suficiente capital para hacerlo, solicita a ceprodel un préstamo que le permita comprar una paca de cartera, zapatos usados, paca ropa de cama y de juguete, para cumplir con los pedidos que esta teniendo.
De esta manera siente que le estararemos ayudando a tener una mejor calidad de vida y comodidad para su familia y también mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Xóchitl, 29, is married and the mother of a beautiful little girl. She is originally from the department of Masaya. She has owned her own business for two years. Previously she was a salaried employee in one of the worker businesses that are very common in our country. She decided to quit and thought that with her severance pay she could start up her business and that is how she started to work. Her business is buying and selling bales of second-hand clothing and shoes. She opened her market in Matagalpa, where her customers are, and she thinks it has gone well, because she has gotten good results. She also wants to expand to other nearby departments and that way increase her business.

Xóchitl needs to buy merchandise, but she doesn't have enough capital to do it. She is applying for a loan from Ceprodel that will allow her to buy a bale each of purses, used shoes, bed clothes, and toys, to meet the orders that she has. This way she feels that we will help her to have a better quality of life, more comfort for her family, and her business will also improve.

loans.use: to buy purses, second-hand shoes, bed clothes, and toys in bulk.

loans.name: Tsogtbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Tsogtbaatar is 45 years old and lives with his wife and son in an apartment in the Ovorkhangai province of Mongolia. His son is a college student. He worked in South Korea from 2006 to 2009. He started a taxi service business after he came back home. His daily income is 20,000-30,000 MNT. His wife is planning to start a jewelry retailing business. He asking for a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase jewelry for his wife's business. He is a hardworking and neat person who says, "It is tough to cover all family expenses from taxi business. The family income will increase and living situation will get better when my wife starts to generate profit."

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for his wife's business

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is married with four children. She is 52 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Fe is a very hard working entrepreneur who has an ambulant dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Shinetsetseg

texts.en: Ms.Shinetsetseg is 28 years old and lives with her mother, father and 2 siblings in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. She has been working at a beauty salon as a beauty specialist since 2004. She has her own equipment at the beauty salon. She is currently planning to open her own beauty salon. Her living standard is good and she is financially responsible in terms of debt. She has good debt record with Xacbank. Now, she is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy equipment, tools and inventory to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy equipment, tools and inventory to open her own salon

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Shirly works hard to support her family.

She has sells herbal medicine in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear clothing. Shirly is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of herbal medicine to sell.

Shirly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Pulo Jaya Group

texts.en: Suharni, 34, is married to Dudin. They have three children. Dudin works and has a salary of 1,800,000 IDR per month, but the number of dependents has required her to have other income. Suharni like to cook and many people like her cooking. Suharni started her business by opening a canteen in a school, but now she has opened a food stall in front of her house, where she cooks soto.  Soto is traditional food of Indonesia: noodles cooked with coconut milk and vegetables. Suharni sell her soto for 6,000 IDR per portion. In the the first few months she kept her food stall open until midnight, but now she stays open longer because many customers still come.

loans.use: to buy noodles, bean sprouts, seasoning, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle shop in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts and other equipment for her motorcycle shop.

Siony has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Siony has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and other equipment for her motorcycle business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 50 years old and married with four children.

Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a recycled materials business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of recycled materials to sell.

Nida has borrowed and paid back 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this business for 10 years and also earns an income from candy making/food vending.

Nida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is from Poblacion, Tangub City. She is 47 years old. Prescila is separated and has 3 children. To make a living, she makes and sells food in the market. She's been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns about 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, she joined GDMPC. Prescila is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food for sale

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela, una señora de 66 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León , quien lleva más de 20 años trabajando como comerciantes vendiendo cosméticos, ropa y mercadería variada, es madre de 6 hijos los cuales viven independientes . Este negocio lo inicio con  una amiga que viajaba fuera del país a comprar mercadería variada para vender en la ciudad , luego inicios a trabajar de manera independiente consiguiendo sus propios clientes poco a poco se fue abriendo camino al mundo del comercio y fue precisamente con este negocio que educo y crio a sus hijos.
Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar cosméticos, tratamientos para el cabello y la cara, ropa interior, camisas, pantalones. La época navideña está cerca y necesita surtir de mercadería variada su negocio para poder vender. Su meta es lograr convertirse en una comerciante mayorista.
texts.en:
Angela, 66, lives in the city of Leon.  She has been working for more than 20 years, selling cosmetics, clothing and a variety of merchandise.  She has 6 children who are all independent.  She started this business with a friend who was traveling out of the country to buy a variety of merchandise to sell in the city.  Later she started working independently, building her customer base over time. This is how she gradually made her way into the world of commerce, and with this business she managed to educate and support her children.  

Angela needs a loan to buy cosmetics, hair and facial treatments, underwear, shirts and pants.  The Christmas season is approaching, and she needs to stock up on a variety of merchandise for her business so that she will have products to sell.  Her goal is to become a wholesale trader.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hair and facial treatments, underwear, shirts and pants

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a motorcycle and jeepney transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF, to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle and jeepney that she uses in her business.

Criselda has been in this business for four years. Criselda earns additional income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle and jeepney maintenance.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 47 years old and married, with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

Tessie has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store.

Tessie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Jose Anselmo

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, tiene una hija de 10 años de edad, vive en un barrio suburbano de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula junto a su esposa y su suegro.
Anteriormente José trabajaba en una empresa privada de seguridad y hace tres años decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de Jugos naturales. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en los alrededores de la ciudad ofreciendo su producto a clientes de talleres y gasolineras y otros negocios. los jugos son de frutas como de naranja, jugo de caña de azúcar, tamarindo y los vende en bolsa plástica y botellas. También vende hierbas medicinales como quiebra piedra, calaguala y otros. Manifiesta que este negocio es rentable y hasta el momento ha podido solventar las necesidades de su familia. 
Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF y a Kiva, y es por 4,400 lempiras para comprar insumos para la elaboración de los jugos como naranjas, azúcar, botes plásticos y bolsas para. Del préstamo va destinar una parte para comprar cemento y arreglar el piso de su casa que poco a poco la está mejorando. El continúa con su plan ayudando a su hija con los estudios hasta que se gradúe y seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, 37, has a ten-year-old daughter and lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with his wife and father-in-law.  José used to work for a private security firm but three years ago decided to set up his own natural fruit juice beverage business.  He sells from place to place around the city offering his products to customers in auto shops and gas stations among other businesses.  The juices are from fruit like oranges, sugarcane and tamarind and he sells them in plastic bags and also in bottles.  He also sells medicinal herbs like ‘quiebra piedra,’ [‘stone breaker’ - rainforest herb] ‘calaguala’ [a medicinal fern] and others.  He states that the business is quite profitable and to date he’s been able to cover his family’s needs.

He’s asking for a second ODEF and KIVA loan for 4,400 Lempiras to buy supplies like oranges, sugar, plastic buckets and bags to make the juice drinks.  He will also use part of the loan to buy cement to fix the floor at home that’s he’s been gradually improving.  He continues with his plant to help her daughter with her schooling until she graduates and also to continue making home improvements.

loans.use: to buy fruit, bags and sugar and also to buy cement.

loans.name: Mario Norberto

texts.es: Mario tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el municipio de Ilama, Santa Bárbara junto a su hijo. Mario siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, hace 15 años que comenzó con los cultivos de café. La zona donde vive es apta para este tipo de producción. El café lo vende en pergamino húmedo en el mercado local. Mario ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 20,000 lempiras para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para la siembra de vivero de café con el fin de mejorar su finca e incrementar la producción. Su meta es seguir creciendo y mejorando los cultivos para darle un bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: Mario, 32, is single living in the town of Ilama in Santa Bárbara with his son.  Mario has always worked in agriculture and started growing coffee 15 years ago.  The zone he lives in is apt for this type of crop.  He sells the coffee in the damp parchment stage in the local market.  He’s decided to request a 20,000 Lempira loan to buy manure and fertilizer and to pay labor costs to plant a coffee nursery aiming at improving his farm and increasing production. His goal is to continue growing and improving his crops to provide wellbeing for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 46-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has four children, aged 21, 20, 18 and 7 years. Her husband is a laborer and helps to finance their daily needs.

Adela has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for one year. She sells merchandise like soy sauce, vinegar, shampoo, dishwashing liquid and canned goods. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional merchandise like pouch vinegar and soy sauce, shampoo, canned goods, and dishwashing liquid. 

In the future, Adela would like to expand her business to be successful in order to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like vinegar, soy sauce, shampoo, and canned goods

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Sebaco una ciudad altamente productiva principalmente en la producción del hortaliza y arroz  de esta importante ciudad es habitante el señor Carlos Manuel, esforzado y con el buen ánimo de salir adelante con su familia.

 Actualmente trabaja como fontanero, solicita a ceprodel un crédito para pagar la mano de obra de la construcción de un cuarto de habitación en su vivienda, la mejora de su vivienda le dará mayor comodidad a su familia ya que el núcleo familiar ha crecido.
texts.en:
.
Sebaco is a very productive city especially vegetables and rice.  Carlos Manuel is from this important city; he’s hardworking and very much wants to get ahead with his family.  He currently works as a plumber and is asking Ceprodel for a loan to pay to have a bedroom added to his house.  This home improvement will provide improved comfort for his family since his nuclear family has grown.

loans.use: to pay to build a room at home.

loans.name: Eliud Nacor

texts.es:
Eliud, tiene 29 años de edad, casado vive con su esposa y un hijo en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Ilama, Santa Bárbara. 
El ha crecido con sus padres realizando actividades agrícolas y hace 12 años cultiva su propia finca de café. Tiene sus cultivos en la zona montañosa apta para la producción de café, la producción en pergamino húmedo la vende en el mercado local de la zona. Eliud actualmente solicita un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para utilizarlo en pago de mano de obra para sembrar vivero de café y para fertilizar y abonar su finca. Con esta inversión va mejorar la calidad y producción y obtener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Eliud, 29, is married living with his wife and son in a village belonging to the municipality of Ilama, Santa Bárbara.  He’s grown up with his parents working in agriculture and for the last 12 years has been growing coffee in his own farm.   His crops are located in a mountainous zone that’s apt for coffee growing.  His production is damp parchment and he sells it in the local market.  Eliud is requesting a 10,000 Lempira loan to pay labor costs to plant a coffee nursery and to buy fertilizer and manure for his farm.  With this investment he will improve the quality and production and will earn more income to help his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Lui Marie

texts.en:
This is Lui, 41, a resident of Cabrera, Philippines. He is married to Rina, his business partner, and is a father to his children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Lui operates a school/office supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies like pens, bond paper, cartolina (a kind of paper), and the like, without going to a bookstore. He gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy school supplies to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Lui dreams of having a vehicle that he will use in his business, through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of office supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Meyboll Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Meyboll del Socorro trabaja para una escuela pública en el municipio de la paz centro desde hace 9 años como profesora de primaria con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia quien la conforma ella y un hijo, brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas de un hogar.

Actualmente solicita a ceprodel un segundo crédito  para mejora de su casa de habitación con reparación del techo de la cuarto con la compra de: zinc, perlines, clavos y pago de mano de obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Meyboll del Socorro has been employed as an elementary school teacher in a public school in the municipality of La Paz Centro for the last 9 years.  She’s supported her family composed of one son this way; she’s provided him with schooling, food and other basic household needs.  

She’s currently asking Ceprodel for a second home improvement loan to repair the bedroom roof.  She will buy metal sheeting, roof purlins, and nails and will pay labor costs in order to provide better living conditions for her son.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge, casado, padre de tres hijos de 11, 9 y 1 año de edad, es de la comarca las banderas es se dedica a la compra y venta de piedra cantera ambulante. Inicio en este negocio trabajando como chofer y así fue recogiendo dinero para comprar el camión que se lo vendió el patrón a quien le trabajaba. Para salir a vender piedra cantera lo hace con ayuda de una persona a quien le paga por cada viaje que realiza.
 El necesita este crédito para invertirlo en comprar más piedras cantera para la venta que realiza ambulante esto le será de ayuda ya que así podrá comprar mayor cantidad de piedra cantera para salir a vender y obtener mejores ganancias. 
Uno de sus planes futuros es ir mejorando la infraestructura de su casa para que sus hijos tenga un techo digno y ahorrar para darles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Jorge is married and the father of three children, ages 11, 9, and 1.  He's from the Las Banderas region and makes a living buying and selling quarry stone as a street vendor.  He started this business as a driver and saved the money to buy the truck from his boss.  He goes out to sell the stone with the help of someone whom he pays for each trip he makes.

He needs this loan to invest in buying more quarry stone to sell, which he does as a street vendor.  This will be a big help to him because he'll be able to buy wholesale stone to sell and get better profits.

One of his plans for the future is to continue improving the infrastructure of his house so his children have a decent home.  He also wants to save money to give them a good education.

loans.use: to buy quarry stone

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retail business.

Analyn has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from rice milling, farming rice, and selling veterinary products.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Helen

texts.en:
Ma. Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

Ma. Helen has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Ma. Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rosita is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fish net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities thanks to her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy a fish net and other fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 44 years old and married, with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Evangeline is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is 59 years old and married, with six children. She earns a living by farming and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Evelina has been farming and selling vegetable for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and buying and selling rice.

Evelina is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and married, with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 6 years and also earns an income from farming rice and coconut and from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Helen has requested a 12,000 loan PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store. She has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Helen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ingredients she needs, like meats, rice and seasonings, for her prepared foods business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Antonia works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and firewood.  Antonia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Antonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 58 years old and married with four children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal and firewood in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal and firewood to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business of buying and selling charcoal and firewood for ten years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Vania Lizbeth

texts.es: la Sra. Vania tiene 19 años,  tiene un hijo de la edad de 3 años,   se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Vania va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Vania va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Vania es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Vania is 19 years old, has a son who is 3 years old, and sells cosmetics by catalog. She sells her products as a street vendor, visiting homes and public and private offices in the city of Santa Cruz, where she offers her products. 

This loan is her first sequence in the institution. Vania will use this loan to buy cosmetics in bulk, which are also on sale, and thus offer more variety of products to her customers and increase her profits. The reason for requesting this loan is to keep improving her business. Vania is hard-working and she is happy for the opportunity given because this is the only activity that allows her to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
