She buys large quantities to maintain in inventory. Her goal is to supply her business and improve her output, so that she can provide her son with an education and on a personal level, feel useful by contributing income to the household.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, eggs, lard, sugar, milk, and others for making bread.

loans.name: Elwin

texts.en: Elwin, 31, is a single entrepreneur from Aurora, Zamboaga del Sur. He makes a living by operating a transportation business, which he started 2 years ago. He now earns 6,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, Elwin is borrowing 20,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to obtain accessories and tires. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and hopes to expand his business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en: Nelinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns some additional income from farming rice, bananas and coconuts. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.  Nelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of three school-aged children. She is from Cortes, Bohol. She has been engaged in basket weaving for several years now.

Vilma wants to expand her business, but lacks the capital to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy more materials for basket weaving, such as bamboo sticks, straw, and "buri" (native palm). 

In the future, Vilma wants to explore another venture to augment her income so that she can continually send her children to school for better learning.

loans.use: to buy more materials for basket weaving, such as bamboo sticks, straw, and buri

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 54 years old. He is from the village of Apnia, Akhalkalaki District. Levan is married and lives with his family: his wife, Tamara, and 27-year-old son. Levan leads the agricultural business of the family. In particular, they have 8 milk cows, 33 calves, 200 sheep, 170 lambs, and goats. The family produces cheese and sells it locally. Besides that, Levan cultivates the family-owned agricultural land, where he grows potatoes, barley, and wheat. He does all relevant seasonal work and sells the harvested products. Levan is a very hardworking person with rich experience in his work.

He requested a loan for harvesting potatoes so he can pay the workforce. Harvested potatoes will be sold during the winter months and this will significantly increase his family's income. With the increased income, Levan will sow more potatoes, wheat, and barley, and expand the family's agricultural business. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to cover the costs of potato harvesting

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
This is Epifania, 62, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is single and manages her own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to support her everyday needs.

Epifania operates an internet café. There is more need, more now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing resumes or office documentation. There are also people who would just love to surf the 'net and any social networks. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Epifania dreams of having good health so she can continue managing her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her internet cafe

loans.name: Karachi

texts.en: Karachi is a woman with the urge to move ahead. She is liked by many people because of her kindness, honesty, and above all, the unhidden smile she always has. She always struggles to see that her family has all that they want. Karachi is taking out a new loan so as to expand her current business. She says that thanks to the loans, she has been able to increase her sales and income. She is currently requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, flour, meat, and food flavourings. These are the ingredients she basically needs to prepare foods.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, meat, and food flavourings

loans.name: Jorinda

texts.en: Jorinda is from Panta-on, Ozamis City. She is 40 years old. Jorinda is married and she has nine children. To make a living, Jorinda has cultivated bananas and coconuts for 16 years and she earns 7,000 PHP per month for these activities. In 2008, Jorinda joined GDMPC. Jorinda is requesting a loan of 8,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated  as a result of this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is very enterprising and has had her store for several years. Here she has been able to provide a dignified life for her family using the income she has earned out of this business. She wants to expand her existing business. 

The new loan of 15,000 KES she is requesting is going to be used to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables and cooking oil.

With this investment, she is sure that she is going to increase her sales because she is going to have a greater supply of food.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables, and cooking oil for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop

loans.name: Revolution De Ferrier Group

texts.fr:
Yvrose est la coordinatrice de son groupe Revolution de ferrier. Elle est mariee elle est possede d'enfants. Yvrose voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir aven duit du Charbon. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son bussness.

Des autres membres Revolution de ferrier ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon et ken kay. Yvrose dit que ses défis principal est de venie une grande commercant. Yvrose habite dans la région de ferrier d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité Amboise a dirigé son commerce de Charbon pendant les 15 dernières années.
texts.en: Yvrose is the coordinator of her group, Revolution de Ferrier. She is married with children.  Yvrose would like to use this loan to to invest in the purchase on coal.  She hopes this loan will help her expand her business. The other members of the group need loans for businesses such as coal and  "ken kay". Yvrose says that her main challenge is to become a large merchant.  Yvrose lives in the region called Ferrier in Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Yvrose has run her coal business for the past 15 years.

loans.use: to buy coal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items like sugar and rice for her general store

loans.name: Ahadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bahati est doyenne du groupe Ahadi, entrepreneur, âgée de 58 ans, vendeuse de pièces de rechange (moto, vélo, véhicules, engins,). Elle s’entraide avec son mari. Elle est mère de 5 enfants, ayant tous finis leurs étudient universitaires et ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de payer d’autres pièces à mettre dans son stock (pistons, disque, chambre à air, bourrages, pneus, huile moteur, etc.). la cliente est confortable avec le programme de Hekima. Il sied de signaler une cliente est venu avec son fils.
texts.en: Bahati is the oldest member of the Ahadi group. She is an entrepreneur, 58- years old, and a seller of spare parts (motorcycle, bicycle, vehicles, engines)  She and her husband help each other.  She is mother of five children, all of whom have finished university and already have their own families.  This new loan will enable her to pay for spare parts to add to her inventory (pistons, discs, air chambers, stuffing, tires, motor oil, etc.) The borrower is comfortable with Hekima's program.  It is worth noting that the borrower came with her son.

loans.use: to buy parts (pistons, discs, air chambers, stuffing, tires, motor oil, etc.)

loans.name: El Fresno De La Soledad Group

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene 61 años de edad el está casado con la señora  Angelina, con el vive una hija la cual estudia una escuela técnica en enfermería y dos nietos que mantiene ya que le ayuda a una de sus hijas con los gastos de sus niños. El pertenece a un grupo que se llama El Fresno de la Soledad y dice que le pusieron ese nombre por que donde hacen sus reuniones había un árbol de fresno y como la comunidad se llama La Soledad decidieron juntar los dos nombres y ponerle así al grupo para que les fuera más fácil a ellos aprenderse el nombre de su grupo. Dice que él tiene una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes desde hace 8 años y que la puso para poder estar más al pendiente de su familia y de su casa, también se dedica al cultivo de aguacate y maíz el cual sale a venderlo a la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de él. Dice que el surte sus productos que vende en diferentes tiendas y que dos veces por semana.
Platica que puso su tienda para mejorar la economía de su casa y porque cerca de ahí no hay tiendas bien surtidas como la de él y trata de tener todo lo indispensable para su venta. Dice que ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de huevo aunque ahorita subió mucho de precio pero es el producto que le piden mas, así como azúcar, jabón, leche, cloro, sal, aceite, maizcena, arroz, frijol, chiles, mayonesa, jamón, salchicha, pan empaquetado, papel higiénico, toallas femeninas, etc. El quiere mejorar su tienda porque no quiere perder a sus clientes ya que es la mejor tienda de su comunidad. Dice que también él quiere comprar un poco  de abonos e insecticidas para mejorar sus árboles de aguacate ya que tiene que tenerlos muy bien protegidos por que pronto se vendrán las fuertes heladas y tiene que comprarles buenos abonos para que no se quemen. Los otros cinco integrantes del grupo se llaman Francisca, Omar, Rogelio, Felipe y Luis Antonio ellos invertirán sus créditos en planta de aguacate y abonos, frutas y legumbres de temporada e insumos para huertas de aguacate para su venta.
texts.en:
Don Juan is 61 and married to Señora  Angelina. Living with them are one daughter who studying nursing in college and two grandchildren. They help one of their daughters to support her children. Juan belongs to a group called El Fresno de la Soledad [The Ash Tree of La Soledad]. He says that they chose this name because there was an ash tree near their meeting place, and because their community is called La Soledad, and they decided to join the names together to name their group so that it would be easier to remember. He says that he has had a small grocery store for eight years, and that he opened it so that he could better help his family and his household. He also cultivates avocado and corn, which he sells at a supply center in a nearby village. He says that he sells his products twice a week to various other stores. He tells us that he opened his store in order to improve his household income and because there are no well-stocked stores like his in the area. He tries to have all the basic staples in his store for sale. He says that he is now requesting a loan for the purchase of eggs, even though the price of eggs has gone up quite a bit, because it is his most popular product. He will also buy sugar, soap, milk, bleach, salt, oil, cornmeal, rice, beans, chilli, mayonnaise, ham, sausage, bread, toilet paper, feminine products, etc. He wants to improve his store because he cannot afford to lose customers. His store is the best store in the community. He says that he also wants to buy some fertilizer and insecticides in order to improve his avocado trees, since he has to keep them very well-protected against the strong frost that is coming. He also needs to buy good fertilizers that won't burn the plants. 
The other five group members are called Francisca, Omar, Rogelio, Felipe and Luis Antonio. They will invest their loans in the planting of avocado, in fertilizer, in seasonal fruits and vegetables, and in other supplies for growing avocados for sale.

loans.use: to stock up on items for his grocery store and for supplies for cultivating avocado.

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr: La cliente Simisi est la présidente du groupement d’affaire Faida, entrepreneur de hautement expérimentée, elle est mariée et mère de 4 jeunes enfants et de nombreux petits fils et filles. Son mari est sans emploi et demeure trop maladif suite à l’état de vieillesse. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers. Elle commença son entreprise avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 20 cycles dans le programme de micro crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 40 paires de souliers. Les profits de sa micro entreprise lui servent de suppléer aux divers besoins (scolarité, soins médicaux, aliment, habillement, etc.) de son ménage dit-elle. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes
texts.en: The borrower, Simisi, is President of the Faida business group.  She is a very experienced entrepreneur, married, and mother of four children and many grandsons and granddaughters.  Her husband is unemployed and remains too sickly due to old age.  The borrower is a seller of shoes.  She started her business with a loan from IMF Hekima.  She just completed her 20th cycle in Hekima's microcredit program. This new loan will enable her to buy 40 pairs of shoes.  The profits from her business will allow her to take care of various household needs (school fees, medical care, food, clothing, etc.)  She thanks Hekima for their support and empowerment of female entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 40 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en: Ibraheem is 23 years old, and from Gaza. He has owned a mini grocery store since 2008. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator, some goods, and display shelves. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income, so that he can continue his higher education in the university.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, some goods, and display shelves.

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es: Doña Olga tiene 51 años de edad y está casada con el señor Alejandro el cual es albañil, ella es parte de un grupo llamado Mariposas platica que es la primera vez que trabajan con Visión Fund y que están muy contentos todos los integrantes ella dice “hicimos nuestro grupo porque todos ocupamos capital para invertir en nuestros negocios, anduvimos preguntando en varias financieras pero ninguna nos convenció como Visión Fund ya que es la que más bajos intereses tiene y decidimos trabajar con esta empresa”. Platica que ella a diario trabaja haciendo tortillas con una señora que aproximadamente hace al día unos 50 docenas de tortillas a mano equivalente a unas 600 tortillas y que trabaja de lunes a sábado para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar aunque a ella le gustaría trabajar por su propia cuenta y tener un negocio estable, dice que le gustaría vender tortillas en su casa y está pidiendo un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de colchas, sabanas, cobertores, toallas, edredones por catalogo, le platico una amiga que se tienen buenas ganancias en la venta de blancos y ella espera que le vaya muy bien ya que compró los catálogos y ya le han hecho varios pedidos ahora nada mas le falta el capital para surtir sus pedidos. Dice que los venderá en pagos para así se les haga más fácil a las clientes el pagar y ella poder recuperar poco a poco. Olga está muy contenta porque dice que le echara muchas ganas para poder hacer su negocio propio tanto de elaboración de tortillas y venta de blancos. Los otros 7 integrantes del grupo se llaman Feliza, Leticia, Ma. Guadalupe, Ana Ma. Arsenia, Juan y Sonia ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de refacciones para carros, en frutas y legumbres de temporada, en zapatos para dama de temporada, en la compra de zapatos por catalogo para vender, en la compra de ropa por catalogo para vender, en dulces para su venta.
texts.en:
Olga is 51 years old, and married to Alejandro, who works in construction. She is part of a group called "Mariposas." 

She says that it is the first time they have worked with Visión Fund, and that all the members are very happy. She says, "We formed our group because we all need working capital to invest in our businesses. We went around asking several financial institutions, but none convinced us like Visión Fund, as it is the one with the lowest interest rates, and we decided to work with this institution." 

She says that she works every day making tortillas with a woman who makes approximately 50 dozen tortillas a day by hand, the equivalent of some 600 tortillas. She works from Monday to Saturday to be able to help her husband with the household expenses, even though she would like to be self-employed and have a stable business. 

She says she would like to sell tortillas from her home. Currently, she is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of mattresses, sheets, bed coverings, towels and comforters by catalog. 

A friend told her that good earnings can be made selling bedding, and she hopes that it will go very well, as she bought the catalogs and people have already made several orders with her. Now all she needs is working capital to supply the orders. She says that she will sell on a payment plan, to make it easier for the customers to pay, and for her to gradually recover her investment. 

Olga is very happy, because she is really looking forward to having her own business, both making tortillas and selling bedding. 

The other members of the group are Feliza, Leticia, Maria Guadalupe, Anna Maria Arsenia, Juan and Sonia. They will invest their loans in the purchase of goods to sell: car parts, seasonal fruits and vegetables, seasonal women shoes, shoes by catalog, clothing by catalog, and candy.

loans.use: To buy mattresses, sheets, bedcovers, towels, and comforters by catalog for her sales business.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lenie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs. Lenie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF, to purchase additional fish for her fish vending business.

Lenie  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.en:
Tarcila is 45 years old and married with one child currently going to school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Tarcila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Tarcila requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Tarcila has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Tarcila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy items like shampoo and groceries, to sell in her store.

NWTF is re-listing Ma. Chona's business profile for this new loan, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries, to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks for her poultry project.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en: Nathaniel is a well-known merchant, who is still selling phone accessories in the store. He has established a good base of regular customers. His customers like him because of his perfect work, in addition to his inexpensive products that are original and of high quality. Nathaniel is currently asking for another loan to use to pay school fees for his son. He has the urge to continue to be in business.  He is thankful for the loans he is getting from Kiva and Yehu. They have been of help to him.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his son.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es: Dora Elia tiene 31 años de edad y es originaria de una localidad llamada Macutzio donde su principal actividad es el cultivo de hortalizas y cultivo de  flor de noche buena, ella es parte del grupo Las Divinas y dice que le pusieron ese nombre por que cuando abrieron su grupo estaba de moda una novela donde salían unas chicas llamadas las divinas y para que su nombre del grupo sonara bien le decidieron poner ese nombre “Dora se ríe vergonzosamente cuando dice el nombre del grupo” platica que ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas reafirmantes, exfoliantes, hidratantes para la piel, cosméticos como rubores, maquillajes en polvo y liquido, pintura de uñas y artículos para el hogar ya que trabaja con 3 empresas que venden por catalogo, dice que tiene con su negocio desde hace siete años y que le gusta trabajar en lo que hace porque así a conocido a mucha gente de otras comunidades y también puede estar al pendiente de su casa ya que tiene 3 hijos y está casada con paulino el cual se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas. Comenta que esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de los artículos que le piden sus clientes y dice que ya tiene varios en espera ya que ahorita no tiene capital para surtir ya que les vende a sus clientes por pagos. Dora dice que surte sus productos en distribuidores autorizados ya que le dan bajos costos de los que surte y también quisiera vender colchas por catalogo. Ella dice “me gustaría también vender las colchas para así poder aportar un poco más a mi hogar y asi poder comprarles a mis hijos lo que ocupen para su educación, hay veces que no se puede comprar todo a la vez es por eso que le estoy echando muchas ganas para poder comprarles ropa y zapatos nuevos y no se segunda mano como suelo comprarles ya que no me alcanza abeces y sonríe tímidamente”. Las otras tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Rosalinda la cual invertirá su crédito en la compra de ropa para damas y caballeros, María Guadalupe ella invertirá en surtir hilos, marquice, agujas, estambre para la elaboración de manteles, servilletas, almohadones etc. para su venta y Victoria que ella invertirá su crédito en surtir colchas y zapatos de diferentes marcas por catalogo.
texts.en:
Dora Elia is 31 years old and is a native of a community called Macutzio, where her main occupation is cultivating vegetables and growing poinsettias. She is a member of the Las Divinas Communal Bank and says that they gave it that name because when they started the group a very popular serial started about some girls called Las Divinas and the group thought it sounded good and decided to name themselves that. Dora laughs a bit ashamed when she says the name of the group.

She says that she sells perfume for women and men, firming creams, scrubs, skin moisturizers, cosmetics, such as blush, powder and liquid makeup, nail polish and household items. She works for three companies and sells by catalog. She has had this business for seven years and enjoys the work because she meets many people from other communities and she can also take care of her home since she has three children and is married to Paulino, who farms vegetables. 

Dora is requesting a loan in order to purchase items her customers have requested. She says she already has various things on order since right now she does not have the capital for supplies because she sells to her customers on credit. She notes that she buys her products from authorized distributors because they give her good prices. She also wants to sell quilts by catalog. She says, “I would also like to sell quilts so that I can provide a little more to my household and thus be able to buy my children what they need for their education. There are times when I cannot buy them supplies all at once. That is why I am so eager to buy them new clothes and shoes and not second hand items, as I am used to doing since at times I do not have enough,” she says, smiling timidly.

The other members of the group are Rosalinda, who will invest her loan in buying clothing for ladies and gentlemen, Maria Guadalupe who will invest in thread, frames, needles, and yarn to make blankets, napkins, cushions, etc. to sell and Victoria, who will invest in stocking up on quilts and different brands of shoes by catalog.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, cosmetics, household items and quilts by catalog.

loans.name: Ideagwa Eneriko

texts.en:
Ideagwa is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 8; two of them go to school.

Ideagwa runs a general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. She is taking a loan of 1,600 sdg (Sudan pounds) to purchase tomatoes, rice and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Ideagwa would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Ideagwa says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, rice, etc.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihas is a 62-year-old married man from Gaza. He has owned a grocery store since 2008 in which he sells different kinds of food, home appliances, drinks, and candies; this helps him make ends meet for him and his wife.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a refrigerator and develop the space of the grocery store. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and develop the space of the grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, aged 56, is from Kitale County, where she lives with her husband. All her children are adults and are between the ages of 21 and 41. She has been in farming for 15 years, doing mixed farming producing maize, beans, eggs and fruits, which she sells locally. She also runs a grocery store as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a 30,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan form Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry and start a poultry project, which will help her in getting more income and uplift her standards of living.

Airborne poultry diseases are her major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her chainsaw

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en: As a married mother of five children, Wilfreda works hard to support her family.  She has a business selling jewelry in the Philippines.  Wilfreda is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more jewelry to sell.  Wilfreda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shells-crafting business in the Philippines.

Porferia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shells-crafting business.She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Porferia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shells-crafting business.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha, 26, is a humble, hard-working person, who lives with her husband and two children. She works in food vending, selling food door-to-door. She has been in this business for the last four years, and she is grateful that it has given her the potential to remain in business.

Esha is requesting a loan from Yehu, in order to have the money she needs to buy more ingredients (such as cooking oil, baking powder and beans) for preparing food to sell.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, such as cooking oil, baking powder and beans.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijo en casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la venta de cerdos, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro  y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la crianza de cerdos la tiene ubicada en un terreno cerca de su vivienda, comercia en los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Guadalupe es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y muy luchador siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito,  en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y desea realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar cerdos. Guadalupe tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Guadalupe lives together with his life partner and his children in their own house. He works in agriculture, specifically selling pigs. He has worked in this field for many years, and this has given him much experience, allowing him to obtain the best earnings. His pig-raising operation is located on a plot of land near his home. He sells in the surrounding areas of his town, and he has gained a lot of customers who prefer to buy from him because of his quality, his good prices and above all his excellent service. Guadalupe is an enterprising man who is dedicated to his work and very determined. He is always looking out for new opportunities that will help him achieve success. In recent months, the demand has risen, and he wants to make a new investment, but he does not have sufficient capital. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will permit him to buy pigs. Guadalupe had good credit references and is very responsible. He promises that he will be able to pay the debt, and at the same time he is confident that it will bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Silanga, Tangub City.  Marife manages a gardening business to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years.  She earns PHP 6,300 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.  Marife has been a member of GDMPC since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of five children. He owns a retail shop, a business which he has been operating for three years. In this shop, Salim sells sugar, flour, soap, salt, etc. The challenge he is facing is bad debts. Salim learned about Milango through a friend and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. He is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to increase his stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He has set his sights on owning a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To increase his stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farming business, and to increase the stock in her cereal shop

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Anecita has been in this business for eight years now. Anecita requested a 29,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business. In the future, Anecita would like to save enough to provide secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is married and has five children. Esterlita is 54 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Esterlita sells food for snacks to earn a living, and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns 1,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP, to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for three years. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a 49 year old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has eight children. 
Prima raises hogs. She has been in this business for ten years. Aside from hog raising, she also engages in selling fish. Her husband is a fisherman and helps a lot especially in the family's daily financial needs. Prima requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine Peso to buy additional piglets, feed, and also for fishing materials like fish nets.
Prima would like to expand her business  in order to be successful and to have a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and for fishing materials like fish nets

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is 65 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Narcisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. Narcisa has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, eggs, snack foods, etc.  In the future, Narcisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en: Arturo is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental.  He is 33 years old and married with two children.  Arturo is a farmer who manages a gardening business to earn their living.  Every month he earns 5,000 PHP from this work.  He has had this work for 4 years.  Arturo requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.  Arturo has been a member of GDMPC since 2011.  His plan is to have his own house and lot.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Damaso Adan

texts.es: Dámaso Adán de sesenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hija, él se dedica al cultivo plátanos y a la venta de maíz y ganado, ya tiene quince años de trabajar en la agricultura lo que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, posee suelo fértil y apto para la siembra, el producto lo comercializa en los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Dámaso es un hombre emprendedor, amable y servicial siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas debido al clima y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar insumos semilla de maíz, plátano, herbicida, abono etc. Dámaso Adán tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dámaso Adán, 65, lives with his life partner and his daughter.  He makes a living growing bananas and selling corn and cattle.  He has 15 years of experience working in agriculture, which allows him to get the best harvests.  His cropland, located in an agricultural area, has fertile soil that is suitable for planting.

He sells his crop on the outskirts of the community, and he has acquired a lot of customers who prefer him for the quality of his product, good prices, and above all his excellent service.  Dámaso is an enterprising, likable, and helpful person who is always waiting for new opportunities for success.

In the last planting season he had some losses because of the weather, and he wants to recover.  This is why he's asking Integral for a loan to buy corn seed, bananas, herbicide, fertilizer, and other supplies.

Dámaso Adán has a good payment record and is very responsible.  He's certain he'll be able to pay back the debt and trusts he'll give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, bananas, herbicide, and fertilizer

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: Minda is 54 years old, married and lives with her five children in Guingona, Ozamis City. For the last 11 years, she has earned about 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month by growing vegetables that she also sells in a local market. She joined GDMPC earlier this year as a way to improve her life and is applying for a loan of 5,500 PHP to buy more vegetables to sell. She plans to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Basilia De Jesus

texts.es: Basilia de Jesús de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y además tiene una crianza de gallinas, tiene varios años trabajando en  la agricultura y eso le ha regalado una amplia experiencia en el rubro que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, todo lo que produce lo comercia en los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Basilia es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando las mejores alternativas que le abran camino al éxito, en esta temporada aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, y gallinas ponedoras para aumentar la producción de huevos. Basilia tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Basilia de Jesus, 49, lives with her life partner and her children. She makes her living farming corn and beans as well as raising chickens. She has several years working in agriculture and that has given her an extensive experience in field that has allowed her to earn a greater income. Her farming land is located in an agricultural zone. Everything she produces she sells in the areas around her town and she has a lot of clients that prefer her because of the quality, good prices, and above all, excellent service. 

Basilia is an enterprising woman committed to her work and eager to get ahead. She is always looking for the best options that will pave the way for success. Demand has increased this season and she wants to make the most of it by investing in her business. This is why she asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy corn and bean seeds as well as egg-laying hens to increase egg production. Basilia has good payment references and a high moral character. She assures that will pay the debt and at the same time that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seed for beans and corn as well as chickens

loans.name: Keji Keri

texts.en:
Keji is a 30 year old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 7.  Two of them go to school.
Keji runs a general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. 
She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. She is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG (Sudanese Pounds) to purchase groundnuts and many other items. In addition to this business she has no other source of income.
In the next five years Keji would like to expand her business.
Her major challenges include high prices in the market.
Keji says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like groundnuts.

loans.name: Ma. Rosanie

texts.en:
Ma. Rosanie is 34 years old and married with one child who is in school. Ma. Rosanie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. Ma. Rosanie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soap, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Rosanie would like to save money to expand her business.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Ma. Rosanie from Philippines

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is requesting a new loan to be able to invest in the business and also to make some improvements to her home. She will invest specifically in the purchase of fruits of different types, water, and food flavors.  This loan will be a great help that will allow her to improve the business and also her home.

With the previous loan she managed to make a good investment as she also carried out other improvements in her house. At this time she is struggling to see her two children graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, water, and food flavors.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 50-year-old widow with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is a hardworking woman involved in a number of activities. She has been an agent for a media company selling newspapers for ten years. She also has rental houses and operates a stationary shop. She began the businesses in order to support her family, as she has been the sole breadwinner of the family ever since her husband died. Florence's clients are corporate companies, schools, hospitals, local government and the general public. 

Florence hopes to educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications and to expand her business to new areas. Florence intends to use this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Cadena De Mujeres Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de dos de las miembros, quienes  fueron las que  reunieron a sus vecinas para la primera reunión y así las señoras  decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, actualmente el comité está conformado por  conformado por  18  mujeres, ellas son  trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
Es parte del grupo la Sra. Selva, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, y gracias a lo cual está saliendo adelante. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser camisas, remeras, pantalones y demás, para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by two members who gathered their neighbors for the first meeting and so the ladies decided to join the work group to get ahead and in this way their lifestyle. Currently, the committee consists of 18 women. They are working women and humble to earn their living every day. 

Selva is a member of the group who makes her living selling clothes and is getting ahead thanks to her work. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes of all kinds such as t-shirts, shirts, trousers, and more in order to continue her work.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a 39-year-old married man from Baclayon, Bohol, Philippines. He has been engaged in appliance repair services for more than ten years now. Juan is repairing appliances in their community for a certain fee. This is the source of his income.
Juan is asking for a loan worth 6,000 PHP to buy more tools such as screws, screwdrivers, pliers and other hand tools. Juan is positive that this loan could definitely help him improve his livelihood. Juan hopes to make his venture a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy more tools such as screws, screwdrivers, pliers and other handtools

loans.name: Bahjat

texts.en:
Bahjat is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his wife appears in his Kiva profile photo.
Bahjat is a 52 year old man, he is married and a father to five sons and two daughters. He receives a low pension which is not enough to cover the family's needs and pay education expenses.
For the past 10 years Bahjat and the family have also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products. This has been a profitable project, especially because he has a good reputation among customers and high customer demand because of the cleanliness of his dairy products. But still it needs more support to cover the costs.

Bahjat is requesting a US Dollars loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep. This will increase sales and improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: To buy more sheep

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is an aged 36 farmer in Kitale County in Kenya where she lives with her husband and five children who are all schooling. Caroline has been in farming for sixteen years producing potatoes, milk, beans and onions, which she sells locally.

She is requesting for a 62,400 KES (Kenyan Shillings) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow that will help her boost her business and be able to pay for her children's education. Caroline aspires to have five dairy cows in the near future.

Poor road networks are one of her major challenges in farming because she has difficulties when it comes to transporting her products.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Los Inversionistas Group

texts.es: Maricela tiene 30 años, una mujer muy alegre a pesar de las adversidades de la vida es una mujer con ganas de salir adelante con sus hijos, recientemente se tuvo que separar de su esposo por problemas personales pero ella está poniendo mucho de su parte para sacar adelante a sus hijos que la quieren mucho. Es parte del grupo llamado Los Inversionistas y dice que le pusieron ese nombre porque sus créditos que piden a la financiera siempre los han invertido en sus negocios y gracias a eso han podido hacer crecer sus negocios poco a poco, Mary como de cariño le dicen comenta que ella tiene varias actividades económicas para poder comprarles lo necesario para su educación a sus hijos ya que son 2 los cuales estudian la primaria. Dice que a muy temprana hora ella se levanta a hacerles de desayunar para después llevarlos a su escuela y enseguida saca su puestecito que tiene fuera de la escuela de sus hijos donde vende refrescos, dulces, gorras, blusas, vestidos tejidos a mano que ella misma realiza, también dice que en los meses de frio hace bufandas, gorros, guantes tejidos y se le vende muy bien. Por las tardes saliendo de la escuela de sus hijos recoge el puesto y hace de comer rápidamente por que luego se va a comprar el pan que después vende una de las principales calles de su población llamada Zitacuaro y los fines de semana se va a un restaurante a trabajar como mesera y así poder ganar unas propinas para aportar a su casa. Dice que ella se siente muy orgullosa de ser madre soltera porque ella sola está sacando a sus hijos adelante con sus estudios y dice “gracias a los créditos me he hecho más ahorradora, responsable y he podido administrar mejor el dinero que gano y he hecho crecer mi negocio y me está yendo bien” dice que por el momento está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material para seguir haciendo sus tejidos y ahora quiere comenzar otro negocio el hacer flanes, pay de queso, pasteles o gelatinas y así venderlos en su puesto donde vende sus tejidos y dulces. La meta que Maricela es tener una casa propia ya que renta una casa y quisiera tener algo propio para no gastar tanto en rentas y tener un local donde tenga segura su mercancía. Los otros nueve integrantes del grupo se llaman Mariana, Eva de los Milagros, José Antonio, Gloria, María del Carmen, Eva, Marcelino, Lucila y Esmeralda ellos invertirán en sus negocios de calzado por catalogo, compra y venta de ropa para dama, en refacciones para un taller mecánico, en frutas y legumbres de temporada, en perfumes, cosméticos y material para hacer bordados artesanales y en abono, fertilizantes para cultivo de chiles manzanos,
texts.en:
Marciela is 30 years old and a very happy woman despite the adversities she has faced. She is a woman eager to get ahead with her children. Recently she had to separate from her husband due to personal problems but she is doing as much as she can to help her children, whom she loves greatly, get ahead.

She is a member of Los Inversionistas Communal Bank and says they chose that name because the loans they request from the field partner are also invested in their businesses and, thanks to the funding, they have been able to gradually grow their businesses.

Mary, as they fondly call her, says that she engages in several activities in order to be able to buy what is necessary to educate her children because she has two in primary school. She says she gets up very early to make them breakfast and then takes them to their school. Immediately afterwards she puts up her stall, which she has in front of her childrens’ school, where she sells drinks, sweets, caps, blouses and dresses knitted by hand that she makes herself. She also says that during the cold months she makes knitted scarves, caps, and gloves and they sell very well. In the afternoons, upon leaving her childrens’ school, she collects her stall and then makes a meal quickly because then she goes to buy bread that she later sells on one of the principal streets of her town, which is called Zitacuaro. On weekends she goes to a restaurant to work as a waitress and thus is able to earn tips to maintain her household.

Mary says that she is proud to be a single mother because she, alone, is helping her children get ahead in their studies. She says “thanks to the loans, they have made me save more and become more responsible and I have been able to manage the money I earn better and I have made my business grow and I am doing well.”

She says that at the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy the supplies to continue doing her knitting. Now she wants to begin another business making flan, cheesecake, cakes and jello and sell them at her stall where she sells her knitted goods and sweets.

Mary’s goal is to have her own home because she is now renting a house and she would like to have something of her own so she won’t have to spend so much in rent. She also wants a space where her merchandise will be safe. 

The other nine members of the group are named Mariana, Eva de los Milagros, Jose Antonio, Gloria, Maria del Carmen, Eva, Marcelino, Lucila and Esmeralda. They will invest in their business of selling shoes by catalog, buying and selling women’s clothing, doing repairs in a machine shop, selling seasonal fruit and vegetables, perfume, cosmetics and will buy material to make embroidered handicrafts and compost and fertilizer to cultivate chiles manzanas (very hot chiles).

loans.use: to purchase material to continue making her knitted goods and now she wants to begin another business making flans, cheesecake, cakes and jello and sell them at her stall where she sells her knitted items and sweets.

loans.name: Enhtor

texts.en:
Enhtor is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ger, Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. He started a wooden furniture manufacturing business in 2000. Mainly, he makes wooden furniture for Ger. Enhtor is well experienced in the industry. 
His son got sick in 2010 and they moved to the capital city for two years to get closer to the hospital. Enhtor stopped the business during those two years and now he wants to open his business back up in Uvurhangai Province and he is asking for a loan of 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugrik) to purchase inventory and raw materials for his business. He is a hard-working and diligent person, who says, "It has been a tough two years since we moved to Ulaanbaatar city and my son was sick. Now I and my wife will work hard to improve our life."

loans.use: To purchase inventory and raw materials

loans.name: Raul Alfredo

texts.es: Raúl Alfredo de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su familia, él se dedica al cultivo de tomate, tiene varios  de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de  cultivo tiene gran potencial agrícola, todo lo que comercia lo vende en los alrededores de la comunidad donde vive y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo con un servicio inigualable; Raúl es un hombre emprendedor, luchador y muy humilde, todos los días se dedica al máximo a su trabajo porque sabe que asi alcanzara el éxito que tanto desea, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse, necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de tomate, herbicida, insecticida etc. Raúl Alfredo tiene buenas referencias de pago, y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Raul Alfredo, 38, lives with his family and grows tomatoes. He has been in agriculture for some years and this has given him a lot of experience, which allows him to get better harvests. The land he farms has great agricultural potential. He sells everything in areas near the community where he lives, and he already has a lot of customers who prefer him for the quality, good prices and, above all, unparalleled service. Raul is a determined man, a fighter, and very humble. Every day he gives 100% to his work because he knows that this is how he will get the success that he desires so much. 

In the last planting season he had some losses and wants to recover. He needs capital, which is why he asks INTEGRAL for a loan to buy tomato seeds, herbicide, insecticide, etc. Raul Alfredo has good credit references and is very responsible. He assures that he will be able to pay back the debt and at the same time trusts that he will bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds, herbicide and insecticide.

loans.name: Rhodelyn

texts.en: Rhodelyn, 33 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Bunawan, Calamba. who has 3 children and makes a living from her transport service business. She started almost 2 years ago and earns 10,000 a month. To improve her business, she is borrowing 50,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which she joined in 2009 to obtain accessories and tires. She is hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of six school-aged children from Cortes, Bohol. She has been  engaged in a basket weaving business for more than 15 years now.
Venancia works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the schooling of their children.
Venancia plan to expand her business that is why she is requesting a loan to buy more materials for basket weaving such as straw, bamboo, "buri" or native palm and others.
In the future, Venancia hopes of making her business grow and become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more materials for basket weaving such as straw, bamboo, buri

loans.name: Grigol

texts.en:
Grigol is 54 years old. He lives in the Bolnisi District of East Georgia. He lives with his wife and mother-in-law. His wife is a teacher at the local school and has a monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard and the family picks grapes seasonally in the autumn. The harvested grapes are used to produce wine to sell. They also sell wheat and potatoes. Each member of the family works hard to improve their living conditions.

Grigol requested a loan to cultivate a plot of land. After the land is cultivated, the family will sow wheat and potatoes. They will do all relevant seasonal work to insure a good harvest. The harvested product will be sold at a good price and this will significantly increase the family's profit. Grigol awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate a plot of land and sow wheat and potatoes

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Asmaa prefers that her photo not be on the Internet.  Thus the photo is of her husband Sameer, who has his photo taken next to the taxi office he owns.  
Asmaa is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to Sameer and is a mother to four sons. She is a housewife and her husband has had a taxi office for eight years. It is a profitable project and the only source of income for the family, but also it needs more support for development and expansion.
Asmaa's husband wants to buy additional taxis for the business in order to provide easier and faster service to his customers. Asmaa decided to help her husband in expanding the office, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing the taxi.
Taking this loan will help Asmaa and her husband to add another new taxi to the business, which will offer better service to their customers. This will increase the family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi

loans.name: Villa Del Sol Group

texts.es:
El comité “Villa del Sol” se encuentra en el séptimo ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas. Y siempre trabajan arduamente por salir adelante.
Mirtha es parte de este grupo y comenta que gracias a la venta de queso que hace, está ayudando a su familia y dándoles todo lo que necesitan para el día a día. La meta de Mirtha es seguir creciendo y el día de mañana convertirse en una gran microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra queso, y así poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The lending group "Villa del Sol" is in their 7th cycle with the Enterprising Women program of the Fundacion Paraguaya. All of the members have productive jobs now and are always working hard to get ahead.

Mirtha is part of the group and comments that, thanks to her cheese sales, she is helping her family and meeting all of their daily needs. Mirtha's goal is to keep growing and in the future to convert herself into a great small businesswoman.

She asks for a loan to buy cheese so she can fill her orders.

loans.use: to buy cheese to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items like soap, oil, etc.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La Sra. Teodora tiene 48 años de edad, es viuda y tiene un hijo ya mayor que siempre la ayuda. La Sra. Teodora  es comerciante hace 7 años, tiene una  despensa bien surtida con todas las comodidades en un lugar bastante poblado de la ciudad. Comenta que comenzó con un pequeño kiosko cuando se mudo sobre la avenida, con mucho sacrificio fue creciendo ya que en la zona hay mucha competencia. Además comenta que está muy orgullosa de su trabajo ya con el su esfuerzo pudo ofrecer la manutención y educación de su hijo único. Ahora su hijo ya le ayuda con los gastos de la casa porque está bien empleado. Teodora solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, fideos, carne, bebidas, y demás insumos para poder seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Teodora, 48, is a widow and has a grown son who always helps her out. Teodora has been a merchant for 7 years. She has a well-stocked dispensary with all of the basic goods in well-populated area of the city. She says that she began with a small kiosk when she moved to the Avenue, and with a lot of sacrifice she grew her business. There is a lot of competition in the area. She also says that she is very proud of her work because with her efforts she has been able to support and educate her only son. Now her son has a good job and helps her with the household costs. Teodora asks for a loan to buy rice, noodles, beef, drinks and other items so that she can continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, beef, drinks and other things.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is a 34-year-old farmer from Kitale County in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and five children. She has been farming for 19 years producing milk, maize and beans, which she sells at the local market in her area. Competition leading to poor prices for produce is her main challenge in farming. 

Milly is requesting a 52,000 Kenyan shilling loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This will help her take care of her children's needs, which includes educating them, and also boost her standard of living. She hopes to have five dairy cows in a couple of years to come.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Fahmi

texts.en:
Fahmi is a 25-year-old single young man. For the past four years, he has had a bookstore selling different types of stationary. The bookstore is located in a good movement area and next to a local school. It is considered a profitable business but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Fahmi is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a variety of stationary items that are usually in high demand from the pupils' side. This will improve the bookstore's condition and increase sales. Fahmi's income will improve which will ensure to him a bright future and better living conditions.

Fahmi has his photo in the bookstore he has.

loans.use: to buy a variety of stationary

loans.name: Conchita's Group

texts.en:
Conchita is 58 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Conchita has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for almost 18 years. She requested a loan to be used to purchase additional groceries for sale.

Conchita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Conchita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries for sale

loans.name: Auma Akeri

texts.en:
Auma is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of five and eleven.  All of them go to school.

Auma runs a general store and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. She is taking a loan of 1500 SDG to purchase rice, sugar, onions, and many other items. Other than this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Auma would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Auma says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, sugar, and onions

loans.name: Neckson

texts.en:
Neckson is a 38-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. In order to sustainably support his family he has a number of income-generating activities which include: a general merchandise and hardware shop, a saloon and a farm. 

Like most businessmen in under-developed countries, he has challenges like price fluctuation and high taxes. These issues not withstanding, he has dreams of educating his children up to university and expanding his hardware shop since it is the most lucrative. Neckson is requesting this loan to buy cement and iron sheets to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron sheets for his hardware shop.

loans.name: Iagub

texts.en:
Iagub is from the village of Dmanisi. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife, who is mother to their two grown children. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They are involved in an animal husbandry business and have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides that business, Iagub grows haricot and maize on the family-owned land. The family does all relevant agricultural works to ensure a good harvest. Iagub is very hard-working person, with rich experience in his work. 

Iagub has requested a loan to purchase another milk cow. He will be able to produce and sell more cheese. In this way, he wants to expand his business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, he will be able to reinvest in his agricultural business. He will also be able to spend more on the family’s daily needs and the family's living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Aidan

texts.en:
Aidan has two children who are in school. She sells used clothing from her home in the municipality of Mombasa.

Thanks to her work, she has been able to provide her children with an education and buy everything she needs for her home. Aida has always demonstrated a good payment history. This is the third loan she has requested from Yehu. She wants to buy clothing so that she can restock her business and offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing so that she can restock her business.

loans.name: Synaita

texts.en:
Synaita is a 37-year-old farmer in Kitale County, Kenya where she lives with her husband and five children, all in school. She has been in farming for 18 years, producing maize, beans and millet that she sells to the people around her local area. Unreliable workers and poor prices, especially when the supply is high, are her major challenges in farming.

Synaita is requesting a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow that would help her venture into the dairy business and increase her income that will later help her to educate her children and boost her living standards. She aspires to be producing 50 liters of milk per day.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is a married woman with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For four years, she has been operating a salon and a boutique shop. With the income earned, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and buy land for farming. She has always had a passion for fashion and this drove her to start the business. Inadequate capital is affecting business growth. Her future plan is to set up a fashion school and expand business to new areas. Jacqueline is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell and cosmetics for the salon.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and cosmetics for the salon.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy snack foods, soap, sugar and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods, soap, sugar and other miscellaneous items to sell.

loans.name: Jonaly

texts.en:
Jonaly, 32, is a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Alexander and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jonaly operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 amount of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jonaly hopes to give her children a quality education and dreams to expand her business through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Draru Okiya

texts.en:
Draru is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 12. All of them go to school.

Draru runs a general store and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. She is taking a loan of 2,000 sdg (Sudanese pounds) to purchase rice, sugar, onions and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Draru would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Draru says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a 45-year-old married man with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda. Thirteen years ago he decided to venture into the cattle trade due to its lucrative nature and has since reaped tangible benefits. With the income earned he has been able to build a house for a residence and pay school fees for his children.

He started with capital from agricultural produce sales, which was his original activity when he started this business. Inadequate capital is the factor most affecting the business, while his desire is to own a ranch and hire employees to help expand his business.

Vicent intends to use the loan to buy cattle ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy cattle ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Israel Baco Group

texts.en:
“Israel BACO” is a group of 13 owners of small businesses chaired by Venant. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Venant is 71 years old and married. He sells poultry products on a retail basis. He started his business in 2008. He likes his business because it makes enough profit to support his family financially. His business brings in US$35 per week. Venant is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received five different loans and has repaid them properly. 

Due to the high demand of his clients, Venant decided to use the next loan to increase the inventory of his products by purchasing more products in bulk to resell them at a profit in order to increase the profits. Venant is the father of five children whose ages vary between 6 and 14 years old. Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase poultry products in bulk and resell them at a profit.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old young man. He is married and a father to one son three months old.

Ahmad's wife is a housewife, while he is employed and earns a low salary. His salary is the only source of income to the family and is not enough to cover all their needs.

Ahmad lives in a clean and calm area, and his house is distinguished by being clean and tidy. Ahmad wants to provide comfortable and necessary furniture for his family, so he is requesting a USD 1,000 loan from FATEN to complete the price of purchasing dining room furniture. Taking this loan will offer to Ahmad and his family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house. 

Ahmad is photographed in his house.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for his house

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
This is Jason, 35, a resident of Manila, Philippines. He is a father of two children. At this time, he is working hard to be able to send his children all the way through college. He manages his own household while operating the business.

Jason operates an internet café business. There is more need, now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. His main patrons are students, who require his services for school requirements. He also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or any office documentation, as well as people who would just love to surf the 'net and any social network. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 450 Php (Philippines pesos) in profit every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy an additional computer, mouse, keyboard, mouse pad, and other supplies for his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Jason dreams to be able to give his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Nowah

texts.en:
Nowah lives together with her friend and four children in Sinkor. Her children are between the ages of 6 and  27; three of them are in college, while the younger one is in school. Her husband works in the government sector, and he gave her the initial capital to start in this business. She has been operating a provision shop for the past 10 years, where she sells beans, vita, bath soap,  hair grease, bread, soft drinks, mineral water and many other items. Nowah learn to sell from her mother. Because she has what her customers need, she makes a profit when she sells. With the profit generated from the business, she'll buy more goods and repay her loan.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase more soap, hair grease, soft drinks, vita and bath soap for the business. Her plan for the future is to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, hair grease, soft drinks, vita and bath soap for the business.

loans.name: Amani Baco Group

texts.en:
Christian, aged 43 and married, is the chairman of the Community Bank “Amani BACO,” which is composed of eight members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Christian started his business in 2006. He sells charcoal at the market located north-east of the city of Lubumbashi. Besides that, he also runs a sewing workshop. He is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received 13 different loans and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to reinforce his business by purchasing sewing items and more sacks of charcoal in bulk that are needed by his customers and reselling them at a profit with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of US$100 per month. 

Christian’s ambition is to develop his sewing workshop in his environment. He is the father of seven children aged between 2 and 16 years old. Five of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his business by buying sewing items and more sacks of charcoal and reselling them at profit

loans.name: Salvador Orlando

texts.es: Salvador Orlando de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol y adicional a esto posee una venta de leche, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de siembra esta ubicado en un lugar de alto potencial agrícola, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque todo el producto es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un excelente servicio; Salvador es un hombre entregado a su labor, luchador día a día se esfuerza por salir adelante sabe que solo con esfuerzo y constancia logrará  el éxito que tanto desea, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aprovechar y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, una vaca, etc. Salvador Orlado tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Salvador Orlando, 45, lives with his life partner and children in his own home. He makes his living in agriculture, specifically farming corn and beans.  In addition to this, he has a business selling milk.  He has been working in this business for several years and this has given him a lot of experience which has allowed him to obtain the best harvests. The land used for farming is located in an agricultural zone. He sells his crops in the surrounding areas around his neighborhood.  He has a lot of clients that prefer him because all of his products are of high quality and affordably priced as well as his excellent service. 

Salvador is a devoted to his work, striving every day to get ahead. He knows that only with effort and perseverance he will achieve his goal that he strongly desires. He wants to make the most of this season and make an investment in his business, but he needs the capital.
