This is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy corn and bean seeds as well as fertilizer, insecticide, and a cow.  Salvador Orlando has good payment references. He assures that will pay the debt and at the same time that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: corn and bean seeds as well as fertilizer, insecticide, and a cow

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila is a fifty-seven-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She is the mother of a twenty-two-year-old son. She has been in the tailoring business for twenty-one years. She operates her tailoring business at her home. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase a new sewing machine, additional cloth, thread, and sewing needles. In the future, Teofila would like to invest in other ventures to have a sustainable and peaceful livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, cloth, thread, and sewing needles

loans.name: Consolation Baco Group

texts.en:
Consolation Baco is a Community Bank made up of 6 members whose chairwoman is Mireille. These members are united for the same goal--to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through the MFI HOPE RDC. 

Mireille sells manioc flour in detail. She began her business in 1987. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. Mireille is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having thirteen times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying more sacks of manioc flour in bulk and reselling them at a profit in her environment. Her business generates a profit of US $110 per week. Mireille is 40 years old, married and the mother of a daughter who is 6 years old and goes to school. Mireille’s dream is to open a manioc facility and become a provider in her area.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of manioc flour in bulk to resell them at a profit

loans.name: Elba Elizabeth

texts.es: Elba Elizabeth de veinticinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y además a la venta de gallinas, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el terreno donde crían los animales  esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, adicional a esto,  comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija que la prefiere por la calidad, buenos precios y excelente servicio; Elba es una mujer activa, enérgica y dedicada a su labor siempre esta buscando las mejores alternativas que le abran camino al éxito y no piensa rendirse hasta lograrlo; en la ultima temporada de venta tuvieron algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita Cerdos, gallinas, etc. Elba Elizabeth tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elba Elizabeth, 25, lives with her life partner and her children.  She makes her living raising pigs and selling chickens.  She has worked in this business for several years and this has given her a lot of experience which has allowed her to earn a better income.  The land used for raising the animals is located in an agricultural zone and very close to her home. She sells her products in the areas around her neighborhood and she has earned many clients that prefer her because of the high quality, affordable prices, and excellent service.

Elba is an active and energetic woman dedicated to her work.  She is always looking for the best options what will pave the way to success and does not intend to stop until she does. In her last sales season, she had some losses and would like to recover them. This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy pigs, chickens, etc.  Elba Elizabeth has good payment references. She assures that will pay the debt and at the same time that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Monhhishig

texts.en: Monhhishig is a 45-year-old widow who lives with her children in Ger, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her oldest two children are college students and her youngest two children are secondary school students. She opened a beauty shop business in 2009 at a rental counter in a local market. Currently, her working capital is 3,000,000 MNT and her monthly income is 450,000-600,000 MNT. She is building a house for her family in order to lower the coal and firewood consumption and stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winter. She is asking for 1,500,000 MNT to purchase materials to finish her house, currently in the process of building.

loans.use: To purchase materials to finish her house

loans.name: Le Modele De Dorneu Group

texts.fr:
Kercita est la coordonatrice de son groupe Le Modele de Dorneu. Elle est marie et elle a 5 enfants. Kercita habite dans la région de nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. 

Kercita a dirigé son commerce de produits divers pendant les 7 dernières années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Elle a vendu l'artisanat. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avec duit du Vetement, chaussures, cosmetiques, etc. Kercita espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. 

Des autres membres trinite ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, la nourritures, cosmetique et chaussures. Kercita dit que ses défis principal est de un grand commercant.
texts.en:
Kercita is the coordinator of her group "Le Modele de Dorneu".  She is married and has five children.  She lives in the northern region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and the water supply very limited.

Kercita has been running her own business, selling various products, for the past seven years.  Before being involved in this type of business, she used to sell traditional crafts.  She would like to use her loan to invest in such products as clothes, shoes, cosmetics etc.  She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business.

Other members of the group also need this loan to boost such businesses as charcoal sales, food product sales, cosmetic and shoe sales.  According to Kercita, her main challenge is to become a major retailer.

loans.use: to buy various goods (shoes, clothes etc..)

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 34-year-old married woman, and the mother of three children. In August 2010, she opened a convenience store to increase her income in order to cover her family's expenses. Her husband is sick and he can't work at all.

Ghada faced many difficulties in the beginning when she started her business because she had to take care of her children and sick husband at the same time. Her children supported her a lot, which helped her to be able to increase her business. She sells food, sweets and conserves in addition to makeup and cotton wear.

Ghada is a hardworking woman. She is well known in the region with a good reputation based on the effort she put in to improve her family's situation.

Ghada applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her food and makeup inventory. This loan will help her a lot in increasing her income and improving her living.

She hopes to keep on expanding her business to cover her children's educational fees and her husband's medical treatment.

loans.use: to increase her food and makeup inventory.

loans.name: Glory Stella

texts.en:
Glory Stella is 43 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Glory Stella is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy more native chickens to raise and sell.

Glory Stella has been raising livestock for nine years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more native chickens and to raise and sell.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Ger, in the Bulgan Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a driver in the Ikh-Alt LLC. 

Enhtuya graduated from the university and has been working as a salesperson in clothing retail for 2 years now. She has obtained lots of experience in this business, and now she is planning to open her own clothing retail business. Her short-term plan is to own a clothes shop in her own place. She is requesting 1,600,000 MNT to purchase clothes and other goods to sell at her retail counter.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and other goods to sell at her retail counter.

loans.name: Tet Trankil De Saillants 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Marc habite dans la ville de trou du nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Marc a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du charbon. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.  Il est pas marié il a 5 enfants.

Marc est le coordinateur de son groupe tet trankil. Des autres membres de Marc ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson. 

Marc dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant . Il dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une moto pour transporter les materiels.
texts.en:
Marc lives in Trou-du-Nord, a municipality located in the northern part of Haiti where electricity is scarce and the water supply very limited. He has been running his own business for seven years and he would like to use his loan to invest in the purchase of coal.  He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business.  He is not married and has five children.

Marc is the coordinator of his group "Tet Trankil".  Other members in Marc's group also need this loan to boost such businesses as coal, rice or fish sales.

According to Marc, his main challenge is that he can never attract enough customers.  He says that his main goal is to expand his business.  His dream is to buy a motorcycle to be able to transport materials.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru:
Айзаде 31 год.   У  Айзады трое детей.Двое детей школьного возраста, учатся в начальной школе и у них есть одна маленькая дочка .В 2008 году окончила Нарынский государственный университет по специальности преподаватель английского языка.По своему характеру Айзада показала себя как очень целеустремленный и  и спокойный человек.  В течении многих лет основным источником дохода для семьи является скотоводство.  Они начали свой бизнес с 10,000 сом. Супруг Айзады помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. У заемщицы имеется 2 коровы, 3  овцы, 3  козы.   Ежемесячный доход  Айзады   составляет 5,000 сом.  
Айзада  обратилась в «Бай Тушум и партнеры» во второй раз, первый кредит она использовала для расширение и развитие бизнеса. В этот раз она запросила 70,000 сом  На взятые деньги он хочет увеличить поголовье мелкого и крупного скота.
texts.en: Aizada is 31 years old and she has three children, two of whom are of school age and attend primary school, and one small daughter.  In 2008, Aizada graduated from Naryn State University with a specialization in teaching English language.  She is a very dedicated and quiet person.  For many years, the main source of income for her family has been livestock.  They started their business with 10,000 Som.  Aizada's husband helps her run her business.  They have borrowed two cows, three sheep and three goats.  Aizada's monthly income is 5,000 Som.  She has come to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for the second time, as she used her first loan to expand and develop her business.  This time she is asking for a loan of 70,000 Som, with which she wants to increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to increase the amount of livestock in her herd.

loans.name: Jezi Konnen Group

texts.fr:
Marieclaude est la coordonatrice de son groupe Jezi Konnen. Elle habite dans la région de CAP-H d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son commerce de vente divers ellel est aussi pendent les 8 dernières années. Elle est marie et elle a 2 enfants.

Marieclaude voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans achete produits divers, que des vêtements, des cosmétiques, des chaussures. Des autres membres des Jezi Konen ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires et des produits cosmétiques. Marieclause dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce pour qu’il devenir un grand commerçant.
texts.en:
Marieclaude is the coordinator of her group "Jezi Konnen".  She lives in the CAP-H region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and the water supply very limited. She has been running her own business, selling various goods, for the past eight years.  She is married and has two children.

Marieclaude would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of various goods (clothes, cosmetics, shoes.)  Other members of the Jezi Konnen group need a loan for such businesses as food products and cosmetics sales.  Marieclaude says that her dream is to expand her business in order to become a major retailer.

loans.use: to buy various goods (clothes, cosmetics, shoes..)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan José de treinta y seis años de edad vive junto a su familia, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo  tiene un gran potencial para la siembra, todo lo producido lo comercia en los diferentes alrededores de la comunidad ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio excelente, pero Juan José adicional a su trabajo  para complementar los gastos del hogar también posee una venta de plátanos; es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, dispuesto a buscar las mejores alternativas que le permitan alcanzar un futuro mas próspero, su mas grande secreto el amor y la constancia porque sabe que así logrará el éxito que tanto desea, en la última temporada aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, abono, plátano etc. Juan José  tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Juan José, 36, lives with his family and plants mostly corn. He has been farming for some years and has gained the experience necessary to obtain better harvests. His land has great planting potential. He sells everything he produces in areas around his community and has many customers who prefer his good quality, prices, and service.

In addition to farming, Juan José sells plantains to meet household expenses. He is enterprising, dedicated, and open to better alternatives for a brighter future. His secret is love and constant attention because he realizes that this is the way to achieve the success he so desires. 

Demand increased this past season, and he wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment. He is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will let him buy corn seed, manure, plantains, and so forth. Juan José  has good payment references and integrity. He is certain he will be able to pay his debt and also make his home financially secure.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, manure, and plantains.

loans.name: Alfajiri Baco Group

texts.en:
Christine is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Alfajiri BACO”,  which consists of five members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Christine is 40 years old and married. She has five children between the ages of 1 month and 18 years old. She has been active in her business since 2000. She runs a sewing workshop in her environment. Her business is the main resource of income she has to support her family. Christine has already received and successfully repaid twelve loans. Thanks to Hope’s loans, the group members’ businesses have prospered. 

Christine is planning with the coming loan to purchase items of good quality that are needed by her clients in order to generate more profit to develop her business and support her family. Her business generates US $60 per week. Her dream is to develop her sewing workshop.

loans.use: to increase the stock of fabric and sewing accessories for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 56-year-old married woman, and mother of six grown up children, from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in a retailing business selling firewood. She also runs a sari-sari store, or grocery store, that has been in place for three years now.

Corazon is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell, such as firewood and dry goods. In the future, Corazon hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as firewood and dry goods

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Ms.Narantuya is 49 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a small house in Selenge Province, Mongolia. She has been working as a salesperson since 1992 and obtained a lot of experience in that sector. Her living standard is normal. 

She is starting to open her own store of clothes and other goods at a rental counter at a shopping center. Her husband will be helping her to run the business of clothes retailing. 

She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy starting inventory and to cover the first month’s rent for the counter at the shopping center. She is a responsible and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to buy starting inventory and to cover the first month's rent of a counter at a shopping center.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Right now Mohammed doesn’t have enough money to buy bulk merchandise. That’s why he is asking for a loan to top up his savings and buy a passenger vehicle. That will give Mohammed what he needs to continue doing his work.

He says that the last loan has improved his living standards and has allowed him to once again request a loan. That funding has allowed him to establish himself in the business and create a better income stream, letting him to maintain his household in a more stable way.

loans.use: to buy a passenger vehicle.

loans.name: C1155 Mukarange Ii Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 54 years old and married with seven children, aged 18 to 33 years old. Her business is well-organized and well-known in the business of selling potatoes. 

Beatrice is the team leader of this group, which is called C1155 MUKARANGE II in the local language. In the picture, she is the one who has raised her hand. Beatrice has been in this business for 20 years and she currently employs four people to help her.

Beatrice has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, to cultivate large quantities of potatoes to sell. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To cultivate large quantities of potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 35, is married and lives at West Point with her husband and three children. She stopped her education in the 11th grade. Her children are between the ages of 2 and 14. They are not in school because she lacks financial support.  

Ruth has been involved in the pastry business for the past eight years. She bakes bread and sells it in her community, and she also serves tea with the bread. She learned to sell from her sister. She makes a profit when she sells.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more flour, cooking oil, sugar, milk, and baking powder for the business. With the profit, she will pay back her loan and help her husband with the expenses of the family.

Her plan for the future is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, cooking oil, sugar, milk, and baking powder for her business.

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
Mrs.Nyamjav is a 60-year-old woman who lives with her husband in a little house in the Selenge Province of Mongolia. She had worked for the Mongolian Railway as a senior accountant for 27 years since 1973. 

She has been planting and harvesting vegetables for the recent few years and is planning to expand her business of vegetable production and sales in the future. Her husband helps her in the business. 

Her house needs insulation and a change of windows in order to decrease the heat loss. She is asking for 1,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum windows to decrease the heat loss of her house before the cold Mongolian winter comes. She is a hardworking and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum windows to decrease the heat loss of her house.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 26 years old and married with two children, aged 3 and 5 years old. He sells various goods, such as sugar, Fanta, rice, lotions and soap. He currently employs one person to help him. He has eight years experience in this work.
 
Jean Claude has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, to buy additional sugar, Fanta, rice, lotions, soap, etc., for resale. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods, such as sugar, Fanta, rice, lotions and soap, for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 42-year-old married man with six children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For the past 10 years, he has operated a produce business, dealing primarily in groundnuts. He started by farming, built capital after good harvests, and decided to start his current business. He likes this business because it has a short value chain. He faces a problem of price fluctuations and inadequate capital, which hinders his business growth. He would like to educate his children, build a good house, and expand his business to other markets. In a bid to earn more profits, he has diversified his business to include maize and beans, since they have a ready market, and it is for this reason that he is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Yafesi

texts.en: Yafesi is a 37-year-old with 8 children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For ten years, he has been in business trading in local brew.  At first he would buy from other traders, but later he bought land and planted bananas, which he uses as a raw material to distill. He also continues to buy from other traders, since demand is high. With the income he has earned, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and to plant more bananas. He started this business after realizing that farming alone could not support his vast family. Yafesi is requesting a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 37-year-old married man, father of one child. He has been working selling alcoholic drinks since March 2008. He used to work as a bus driver, but his family's needs encouraged him to start his own business which changed his whole life.

Hasan is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to start a new business. He will start selling mobile phones, prepaid cards and accessories. His old business is unique in his area, since it's hard to find such a one in Southern Lebanon, because of religious issues. 

This is his second cycle with Al Majmoua, and his previous loan improved his business a lot and covered his wife's eye surgery expenses. His father used to have such a business, that's why he had good experience in it.

Hassan hopes to improve his business more and more to start up a wholesale trade in the future.

loans.use: to start a new business

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa y su madre. Él se dedica al cultivo de cilantro, cebolla y güisquil.  De esta forma brinda lo necesario a su familia.  Después de cultivar la cosecha pone  a la venta cierta parte así suplir sus necesidades del hogar.  Es muy conocido en la zona como una persona honrada, honesta, trabajadora y responsable. Dado que es un hombre con muchas virtudes, sus vecinos le han confiado el cargo de presidente de la asociación de agricultores de la zona donde habita.  Cada día siente que las necesidades de su hogar son mayores por lo que ha decidido solicitar este préstamo a INTEGRAL  para comprar los insumos necesarios como: semillas, abonos, pesticidas u otros.  Para seguir cultivando y que estos  le permitan llevar el pan de cada día de su hogar.  Espera y confía en Dios todo poderoso que obtendrá resultados positivos y logrará  una abundante cosecha que le permita alcanzar su sueño de brindar a su querida familia mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en: José Antonio lives in a house of his own together with his wife and his mother. He grows coriander, onions and chayote. This is how he supports his family. He sells part of his harvest to pay for household expenses. José is know in his neighbourhood as a reputable man who is honest, hard-working, and responsible. Because of his many virtues, he was elected president of the farmers' association of his area. He feels that more money is needed for expenses and thus asks for a loan from field partner INTEGRAL in order to buy the necessary supplies for his business: seeds, fertiliser, pesticides, etc. These will enable him to keep being a farmer and putting food on the table. He hopes for the best and prays God that he will be successful and have an abundant harvest in order to make his dream of improving his loved ones' living conditions come true.

loans.use: to buy the necessary supplies for his agricultural activity.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane, 51 years old, lives in the city of Sevan with her two children, a son and a daughter. Gayane’s husband lives in Russian Federation.

Gayane’s son is a first-year student in an MA course at the International Scientific Educational Center. He is studying in the management department through correspondence. Gayane is asking for a loan of 175,000 Armenian drams to pay for the first semester of her son’s MA course.

Gayane works at a bread-baking plant as a baker. Thanks to her job, she is able to support her family. Her daughter is a jobless. Her son is now seeking work, which he will be able to combine with his studies, and thus meet part of his family’s needs.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s first semester of an MA course

loans.name: Saado

texts.en:
Saado is a 23-year-old from Gaza.
He has owned a shop for making and selling humus and falafel (traditional food) since 2011.
He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator, an electric generator, and a big frying pan for falafel.
He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, an electric generator and a big frying pan for his falafel business.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa has been running a convenience store for several years with his wife, who helps him attend to the clients. They work in the store from Monday to Sunday. He says that the previous loan has been of great help to him.

With this new loan, he hopes to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to grow his business, such as beans, rice, sugar, flour, sweets, detergents, salt, etc. This will help him to increase his sales offerings and better serve his clients.

His goal is to have a better income through his business, so that he can help his parents with some of their expenses and his children with their studies.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, and kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Nassiri

texts.en:
Nassiri's goal is to improve his spare parts retail shop business and to respond to the demands of the market, but his working capital stands as a large impediment to achieving his goals. 

Currently, he is applying for a micro-loan, with which he will expand his shop business and purchase more spare parts. From there, he will really begin his road to achieving his greatest goal of becoming a wholesale supplier of spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Nsubuga

texts.en:
Nsubuga is a 23-year-old married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. After dropping out of school due to lack of school fees, she decided to set up a salon. She also sells clothes  and she got start up capital from her husband. She has a personal goal of educating her children and building a permanent house since she is currently living in a rented house while her business plan is to achieve a modern salon.

Nsubuga is requesting a loan to buy synthetic hair extensions and clothes to sell in the salon.

loans.use: to buy synthetic hair extensions  and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah sells footwear at Asebu Brebia. Sarah has been selling this for the past five years.

She is single and has three children. As a single parent, she is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying school fees for her children. 

She will use her loan to purchases footwear for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her footwear.

loans.use: to purchase footwear for sale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia sells saucepans, bowls, and and other cooking utensils at Asebu near Cape Coast. She has done this for two years now. 

She is married, and her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills.  

Lydia  will use her loan to purchase more saucepans,bowls, plastic bowls, cooking utensils, etc., to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans, bowls, plastic bowls, cooking utensils  to sell.

loans.name: Mo'men

texts.en:
Mo'men is a 21-year-old from Gaza.
He owns a workshop for repairing and painting cars since 2009 and has two employees who help him.
He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a compressor and a new car-painting machine.
He hopes that this loan will help him develop his workshop and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and a new car-painting machine.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma used his previous Kiva loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.  His business has done very well.  He is applying for a loan to expand to a wholesale business to earn more profits in his business. His goal is to attain a larger expansion of his market to reach higher sales than currently.

With the new Kiva loan he’s applying for, he will add stock of sacks of rice, sugar and wheat flour. His message for Kiva lenders is the following: “Continue helping small businesses to improve their income.”

loans.use: To purchase added stock of sacks of rice, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis  is married and has eight children. He has received schooling through form 4. Francis sells charcoal  and firewood  at Asebu Brebia, which he has done  for  5 years now. His wife is a trader. Francis uses his income to pay for his children’s school fees.  Francis will use the loan to purchase an acacia plantation for firewood and produce charcoal. With the new profits, Francis hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase an acacia plantation for  firewood for sale and  to produce charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Las Albercas Group

texts.es: Doña Margarita tiene 54 años y es originaria de San Felipe de los Alzati una localidad donde su principal economía es el cultivo de flor de noche buena y en estos meses son los fuertes para los productores ya que buscan compradores en México a nivel nacional y en otros países para su venta. Margarita es parte de esos productores que año con año hacen ver hermosa la navidad con flores de noche buena espectaculares de diferentes colores, tamaños y especies, ella platica “me siento orgullosa de pertenecer a estas tierras ricas en naturaleza es muy bonito trabajar con la flor mas pedida en diciembre ya que representa la natividad del niño Dios”. Ella desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica a la producción de flor de noche buena y aunque han bajado drásticamente las ventas ya que mucha gente de la región se dedica al cultivo sigue trabajando con la flor ya que es muy buen negocio aunque se le invierta demasiado tiempo y capital, ella ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de abonos, pintura para pintar los viveros y no pinten tan rápido las flores y estén en buen estado y papel por que en menos de un mes empieza la venta en grande, dice que van compradores de todo el país y turistas del extranjero ya que cerca de su localidad como a 20 minutos se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca y en los meses de diciembre arriban las mariposas. Dice que ella maneja diferentes variedades de flores como son la suljibri, japonesa o china, mármol, marble star, monet, prestige, blanca, freedom, salmón, sonora. Dice que su meta es comprar una camioneta con la cual pueda transportar sus flores y venderlas en otros estados del país para no pagar flete ya que sale algo caro. Las otras cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Diana, Erika, María Teresa y Florinda ellas invertirán sus créditos para la compra de insumos para sus viveros de noche buena.
texts.en:
Doña Margarita is 54 years old and is a native of San Felipe de los Alzati, a town whose principal economy is the cultivation of poinsettias, which is a strong crop for producers during these months, because they are looking for buyers in Mexico at the national level and to other countries for their sales. Margarita is one of those producers who, year after year, makes Christmas look beautiful with spectacular poinsettias of different sizes, colors and varieties. She says, “I am proud to belong to this bountiful land; it is lovely to work with the flower that is most requested in December because it represents the birth of baby Jesus.”

She has been growing poinsettias for more than 10 years and, although sales have dropped drastically because so many people in the region also cultivate the flowers, she continues working because it is still a good business, although she invests too much time and capital in it. Right now she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and paint for the greenhouses so the flowers will not mature too quickly and will be in good condition. She also will buy decorative paper because the big sales will begin in less than a month. She says that buyers from all over the country and abroad are coming because about 20 minutes away from her town there is a Monarch butterfly sanctuary and in December, the butterflies arrive.

Margarita says she grows different varieties of poinsettias such as the Japanese, Chinese, Marbel, Marbel Star, etc. She says that her goal is to buy a van to use to transport her flowers and sell them in other states of the country so she will not have to pay freight because it is a bit expensive. 

The four other members of the group are Diana, Erika, Maria Teresa and Florinda. They will also invest their loans to buy supplies for their nursery beds of poinsettias.

loans.use: to buy paper, fertilizer and pay to ship the flowers.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba produces gari, a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava. Araba sells the gari at Asebu near Cape Coast. She has done this for five years now. 

She is married to a farmer and has five children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills. 

Araba will use her loan to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells charcoal at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for two years now. 

Efua is a single parent and has four children. She uses her income to feed her children and pay their school fees.  

Efua will use her loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Efua wants to produce the charcoal  she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is 32 years old. He’s Lebanese and married to Maysa. He lives with her in addition to their two school-aged children. He’s trying his best to build a good future for his family especially his children. He’s responsible for covering their study fees, not to forget their heavy daily expenses. 

Houssam started to work in the construction field in the year 2000. He works on a free-lance basis and has more than a few projects to accomplish. He’s specialized at installing tiles. He’s sure that the more  projects he is able to take on, the higher his revenues will be. 

Today, he has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new tools and construction supplies for his business. He’s going to start his new project very soon, and this Kiva loan will help him accomplish his work in a good way. 

Houssam is very ambitious, awaiting the perfect time to grow in his occupation.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and construction supplies for his business

loans.name: Ekow

texts.en:
Ekow Nuamah is a farmer. He has completed middle school form four. He is single. 

Ekow cultivates cassava for sale at Asebu Brebia and also sells firewood. He has been doing this for 15 years now. He uses his income to pay his utility and accommodation bills.   

He will use his loan to hire labour to work in his farm. Ekow plans to expand his farm with the new profits.

loans.use: to hire labour to work in his farm.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is a friendly, Lebanese young woman. She is 21 years old. She got married few years ago and has only one child. She’s really proud to have such a united family. She is ready to do her best and offer them a respectable life. After their marriage, Hiba’s husband managed the family's expenses. When Hiba noticed that their income did not satisfy their needs, she decided to open her own clothing shop with a small amount of money she already had. She sells a wide variety of clothes from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. Today, she’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to increase her stock, especially with winter clothing.  This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income.

loans.use: To increase her stock and buy winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Kavata

texts.en:
Kavata is very enthusiastic about the growth of her food-stall business. She works every day, doing her best to increase her clientele; and she has managed to do so. Her greatest challenge is that her working capital is insufficient to meet her projected market demand.

This is precisely the need she would resolve with her Kiva loan, her fifth loan with the Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use it to buy rice, wheat flour and maize flour to supplement her food stock and have a greater range of products to meet her customers' greatest needs.

Her dream is to succeed in expanding her business and to keep it stocked at all times with enough food products. While this is happening, she works tirelessly to manage her accounts receivable and a rapid turnover of her stock, which she is managing to invest in, although not in the quantities she aims to have.

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat flour and maize flour to sell in her food stall
